loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa S. sells food items like tomatoes and beans at Elmina. Theresa has received a junior high level education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a welder. Theresa has been selling food items like tomatoes and beans since 2008. She is responsible for feeding the family and paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more fabric and food items for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband to start building a house for the family.

In the picture, on top of her head are a few pieces of fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and food items for sale.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba M. sells food items like tomatoes at the Elmina new market. Aba has received no formal education. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Aba has been selling food items since 2005. She is responsible for feeding the family and paying utility bills. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more food items for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business to increase sales which will eventually increase her income.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel G. sells liquid soap and detergent at Elmina. He has a Senior High school education.  He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. Emmanuel has been selling liquid soap and detergent since 2003. He is responsible for paying the children's school fees and other utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more chemicals to increase his production of detergent and the liquid soap. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest into the business so he can increase sales, which will increase his income.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more chemicals to increase production of the detergent and the liquid soap.

loans.name: Alberta B.

texts.en:
Alberta B. S. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through Junior High Level. Alberta B. sells bags of rice, sugar, and also owns a grocery store at Chapel Square in Elmina, which she has done since 2001.

Alberta B. uses her income to help her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Alberta B. will use the loan to purchase more bags of rice, sugar, and groceries for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alberta B. plans to help her husband to start putting up a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, sugar, and groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Kwamina

texts.en: Kwamina S. is married and has three children. He has a Junior High level education. Kwamina sells fishing items at Ayesa in Elmina, which he has done since 2000. His wife is a trader. Kwamina uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and other utility bills. Kwamina will use the loan to purchase more fishing materials like nets, hooks, twain, floats, and other items. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwamina plans to save towards a family house that he wants to build with his wife.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta D. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preserving, and then sends to the market at Bantama near Elmina. Benedicta has received a vocational education.  She is a single parent and has four children. Benedicta has been selling fish since 2000. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue building her house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of supplies to restock her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cloth and other materials for her dressmaking activities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a large stock of goods to replenish her small grocery store.

loans.name: Wilfried

texts.fr: Wilfried est un commerçant de produits cosmetiques qui a plus de cinq ans d'expérience, il est encore célibataire, il fait un chiffres d'affaires de 40 000 fcfa en moyenne par jour. il s'occupe de lui même et aide ses parents. Il a grâce à ce crédit renforcer ses activités
texts.en:
Wilfried is a merchant deailing in cosmetic products who has more than five years of experience. He is still single. His sales figures average 40,000 francs CFA per day. He takes care of himself and helps his parents. Thanks to this loan, he will bolster his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce : to buy perfumes, hair extensions, and beauty products for his shop

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Fatim D. est une jeune fille qui habite chez sa maman où elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure qui fait un chiffre d'affaire en moyenne de 15 000 fcfa par jour. Elle aide sa maman et gére ses besoins. Le crédit obtenu lui a permis de renforcer ses activités.
texts.en:
Fatim D. is a young woman who lives with her mother, where she has opened a hair salon that averages $33 (15000 West African franc CFA) in sales per day. Fatim serves as an assistant to her mother and manages her affairs. This loan would permit her to expand her endeavors.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for ladies' hair salon

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata K. est gérante de cyber-café qui a plus de cinq d'expérience dans le secteur. C'est avec un crédit de imcec qu'elle a ouvert ce service qui lui permet aujourd'hui de faire des chiffres d'affaires de 20 000 fcfa. Elle vit avec son mari et gére bien sa famille. Le crédit lui a permis de réparer ses ordinateurs et d'aumenter sa clientéle
texts.en:
Fatoumata K. is an internet café manager who has over five years of experience in this sector. Using an IMCEC loan, she opened this service which now enables her to achieve sales figures of 20,000 francs CFA. She lives with her husband and does well running her family. The loan enabled her to repair computers and to increase her customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and maintain computers

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou est une jeune femme qui évolue dans le commerce de parfums et autres produits. Elle a un chiffre d'affaire en moyenne de 5000 fcfa en moyenne. Elle gére ses besoins. Le crédit lui a permis de renforcer son commerce et d'envisager ouvrir une cantineprochainement.
texts.en:
Astou is a young woman who trades in perfume and other products. On average, she does $11 in sales (daily). She manages the business. The loan would permit her to expand her business and to consider opening a small shop soon.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trade, purchase of perfumes, fabric, hair extensions

loans.name: Blás

texts.es:
Blas es un joven olero (persona que se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos) de 28 años de edad, vive en pareja desde hace 8 años con Delia con quien tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años respectivamente.

Comienza diciendo que es el segundo de entre cinco hermanos y que le hubiese gustado terminar alguna carrera universitaria, pero que debido a los problemas económicos de sus padres no pudo hacerlo y desde muy temprana edad tuvo que salir a trabajar para conseguir el sustento diario.

A partir de los 14 años comenzó a trabajar en la que hoy es su profesión, acompañando a su padre todos los días en el trabajo. Hoy día ya cuenta con su propia olería y le da empleo a 3 personas.

Aspira comprar con el tiempo un camión en el cual podría transportar sus productos inclusive hasta la capital en donde conseguiría mejor precio.

En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para la compra de una carreta con bueyes para transportar la materia prima debido a que en la actualidad tiene que alquilar una, lo cual le genera más costos a su producción.
texts.en:
Blas is a young brickmaker (a person dedicated to making bricks), 28 years old, married 8 years to Delia with whom he has two children ages 8 and 6. He begins by saying he is the second of five siblings and that he would have liked to finish a university career but due to economic problems of his parents he could do that and from a young age he had to go out and work in order to be able to eat. Beginning at 14 years old he began to work in what is today his profession, accompanied by his father every day at work. Today he has his own brickworks and he employs 3 people. He aspires to buy a truck with which he will be able to transport his products even to the capital where he can get a better price for his products. With this loan he would like to buy a cart and oxen to transport raw material as today he has to rent one, which results in greater costs to his production.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and cart and 2 oxen

loans.name: Miguel Rolando

texts.es: El señor Miguel Rolando  Talé García   de 40 años de edad, Casado, con dos hijo el originario  del Departamento de Totonicapan actualmente reside en la Calle 3-39 Zona 1, Totonicapán. desde que hera joven  viene trabajando de comerciante, vendiendo en una su tienda de consumo en donde cuenta con variedad de productos de consumo diario la cual ha venido progresando y satisfaciendo la necesidad de los vecinos de la zona 1 de Totonicapán  y el se acerca a las oficinas de Asdir para solicitar un crédito  que será invertido para ampliar su capital de trabajo y mejorar el servicios a los clientes. Atraves de varios productos  relacionados a los meses de Noviembre de los barriletes, en mes de diciembre el de las uvas y otros.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel Rolando Talé García is 40 years old. He is married with two children. He is a native of the Department Totonicapán, although he currently resides in Calle 3-39 Zone 1, Totonicapán. Since he was very young he has worked as a businessman, selling in a consumables shop where he has a variety of daily consumable products which he has progressed and satisfied the needs of the residents of Zone 1 Totonicapán, and he has gone to the offices in Asdir in order to ask for a loan that he would invest to increase his working capitol and better the service to his clients. He needs various products related to the month of November, the month of kites, and in the month of December he has grapes and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capitol

loans.name: Cándida

texts.es:
Cándida es una laboriosa y sacrificada mujer de 49 años de edad. Está casada con Catalino hace 30 años. Del matrimonio han nacido 3 hijos, la mayor se dedica a la docencia, y los demás aún continúan estudiando.

Cándida comenta que hace 18 años montó su despensa en su hogar, pero que antes tuvo que dedicarse a una infinidad de actividades para ganarse el sustento diario. Desde trabajar como empleada doméstica hasta salir a vender mercaderías varias de puerta en puerta.

Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de frutillas y tomates, dependiendo de la temporada.

Hoy día Cándida atiende su despensa y también posee una cantina que funciona en una pequeña escuela rural que queda a pasos de su casa, donde se traslada todos los días para vender sus productos en horas del receso para luego volver a su domicilio.

Desea surtir mejor su negocio para ganar una mayor cantidad de clientela y de esa manera hacer que sus ingresos aumenten día tras día. Es por eso que en esta oportunidad recurre a un préstamo con el fin de llevar a cabo su proyecto.
texts.en:
Cándida is a hard-working and sacrificing 49 year old woman. She has been married to Catalino for 30 years. They have 3 children, the oldest is a teacher and the rest are still studying. Cándida says that 18 years ago she opened a convenience store in her home, but before that she did a number of jobs to earn a daily living, from working as a domestic employee to selling merchandise door to door. Her husband is a farmer, growing primarily strawberries and tomatoes, depending on the season. Today Cándida takes care of the store and also owns a snack bar in a small rural school that is a few steps from their home. She goes everyday to sell her products during recess and then returns home. She wishes to better stock her business in order to have a larger customer base and in this way increase her earning day after day. Therefore she is asking for a loan to carry out this project.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil, sugar, flour, baked goods, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 41 años, está casado con Wilma que tiene 43 años de edad. Tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 12 años respectivamente, ambos aún van a la escuela.

Carlos es taxista, trabaja en tal profesión desde hace 3 años. Comenta con tristeza que su esposa tuvo que viajar a España a fin de obtener un empleo digno y ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar. Desde allí le envía dinero todos los meses.

Él tiene una parada de taxi que funciona frente al Hospital Nacional de la ciudad de Itauguá. Cuenta que sus principales clientes son los enfermos y parientes de los mismos que acuden diariamente a dicho hospital.

Continúa diciendo que anteriormente trabajaba en la Argentina (país vecino del Paraguay), hasta que un día decidió volver e invirtió todos sus ahorros en la compra del vehiculo que hoy día utiliza como taxi.

Su principal anhelo es que su esposa vuelva y poder montarle su propia peluquería ya que ella es peluquera de profesión.

En esta oportunidad necesita del crédito para completar el importe para la compra de otro taxi debido a que le va muy bien en el negocio y desea seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 41 years old, married to 43 year old Wilma. They have 2 children ages 9 and 12, both of whom go to school. Carlos is a taxi driver, a job he has had for 3 years. He says sadly that his wife had to travel to Spain to obtain a decent job and help him with the household expenses. She sends him money every month from Spain. He has a taxi stand across from the National Hospital in Itauguá. He says that his clients are primarily patients and their relatives who travel daily to the hospital. He continues says that previously he worked in Argentina (a neighboring county of Paraguay) until one day he decided to return and invest all his saving in buying a the vehicle that today he uses as a taxi. His primary goal is that his wife returns and he can open his own barber shop as he is a barber by training. For this loan he would like to complete the importing of another taxi as his business is going very well and he wishes to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a vehicle to be used as a taxi

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique tiene 47 años, está casado con Rita hace 21 años y juntos han criado a 2 hijos que hoy día tienen 8 y 10 años respectivamente. Ambos niños aún van a la escuela.

Vivió 12 años en la Argentina en donde trabajó como constructor, ahorrando de esa manera el dinero suficiente para volver a su querido Paraguay a fin de montar su propio negocio.

Fue así que volvió a su país e instaló una pequeña despensa en su hogar y más tarde habilitó su carnicería.

Faena un promedio de 3 animales por semana, ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada que le compra la carne todos los días.

También cuenta con vacas lecheras que ordeña para luego vender la leche.

En esta oportunidad necesita del préstamo para la compra de animales para engorde con el fin de faenarlos más adelante.
texts.en:
Enrique is 47 years old, married for 21 years to Rita and together they have raised 2 children who are today ages 8 and 10. Both children go to school. He lived 12 years in Argentina where he worked in construction, saving enough money to return to his beloved Paraguay to finally open his own business. When he returned to his country, he opened a small store in his home and later a butcher shop. He butchers on average 3 animals per week, and he has a good customer base who buy meat from him every day. He also has milking cows and he sells milk. He needs the loan in order to buy animals to raise and fatten with the goal of butchering them in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy animals to butcher for butcher shop

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 28 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive actualmente con una hermana mayor. Cuenta que proviene de una familia muy numerosa que está compuesta en su totalidad por 11 hermanos, 8 mujeres y 3 hombres.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a la fabricación de alimentos balanceados para animales, actividad que desarrollaba junto con su padre. Lastimosamente el mismo falleció hace 8 meses por lo que tuvo que cerrar su pequeña fábrica. Fue en ese momento que decidió trabajar con su hermana en la confección de prendas de vestir debido a que era una actividad familiar que ya conocía y podría salir adelante nuevamente con dicho trabajo.

Hoy día realiza trabajos sobre pedido para un comerciante mayorista para quien confecciona los trabajos en forma constante.

Necesita de un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina de coser más, debido a que tiene muchos pedidos que cubrir y de paso le dará trabajo a otra persona.
texts.en:
Fernando is 28 years old, single, with no children. He lives with his older sister. He tells us he comes from a large family of 11 siblings - 8 women and 3 men. Previously he worked in making animal feed, an activity he did with his father. Sadly his father died 8 months ago so he had to close his small factory. It was at that moment he decided to work with his sister in making clothing items as it was a family trade that he knew and would be able to be successful again in that profession. Today he makes items to order for a commercial wholesaler for whom he has continuous orders. He needs a loan to invest in buying another sewing machine, as he has many orders to meet and he will be able to employ another person.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ludio

texts.es:
Ludio es un joven profesional de 33 años de edad, vive en pareja con Agustina hace 9 años. De la unión de ambos han nacido dos niños, que hoy tienen 4 y 6 años respectivamente.

Él es técnico en refrigeración, desempeñando tal labor desde hace 10 años. Comenta que comenzó trabajando con su hermano mayor quien le enseñó todo lo que sabe.

Hoy día ya tiene montado su propio taller en su casa, donde repara todo tipo de heladeras, congeladoras, aire acondicionado y lavarropas.

Comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio y que ya cuenta con una cantidad importante de clientes.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos en desuso que luego él repara y pone en condiciones para volverlos a vender.
texts.en:
Ludio is a young 33-year-old professional. He has lived with his girlfriend Agustina for the past 9 years. The couple has two boys, who are 4 and 6 years old respectively.

He is a refrigerator technician, which is a job he has been doing for 10 years. He says he began working with his older brother who taught him all he knows.

Today he has his own workshop set up in his home where he repairs all types of refrigerators, freezers, air conditioners and washing machines.

He says the business is going well and he now has a good number of clients.

He is requesting a loan to buy used electrical household items, which later he will repair and recondition so that they can be resold.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used electrical household items.

loans.name: Comite Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty se inició mediante la acción emprendedora de la actual presidenta quien se interesó por el programa y se propuso a formar su Comité con sus vecinas y conocidas.

El comité se encuentra conformado por mujeres de escasos recursos, la mayoría de ellas viven en un asentamiento denominado San Cayetano de la ciudad de Capiatá.

Son señoras trabajadoras y entusiastas, valoran el préstamo ya le da la posibilidad de contar con buen capital de trabajo y por sobre todo al mismo tiempo fomentar la amistad entre ellas.

Destinan sus créditos a: compra de ropas, frutas y verduras, cosméticos, ingredientes para la cocción de comidas, compra de mercería como; jarras, ollas, repasadores, etc.

El grupo posee de una buena cantidad de ahorro el cual se encuentra depositado en una financiera.

Todas agradecen la oportunidad brindada por la Fundación Paraguaya.

Se destacan por la solidaridad y la unión que reina dentro del Comité Kuña Aty.

Las actividades que desarrollan se detalla a continuación: 1-Brígida B. – Venta de mercería. 2-Selva B. – Venta de ropas. 3-Celia G. – Venta de ropas. 4-Hermogena T. – Venta de comidas. 5-Sonia C.– Venta de ropas. 6-Alfonsa I. – Venta de ropas. 7-Alejandra O. – Venta de comidas. 8-Eugenia O. – Venta de cosméticos. 9-Agueda V. (ausente en la fotografía) – Venta de frutas y verduras. 10-Cheni A. – Venta de comidas. 11-Estela Gómez – Venta de cosméticos. 12-Dora Estela – Venta de frutas. 13-Olga P. – Venta de ropas. 14-Liza Gómez – Venta de mercería. 15-Cristina M. – Venta de frutas.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Aty began through the enterprising action of the woman who today serves as the group’s president, as she became interested in the program and proposed forming a committee with her neighbors and acquaintances. The committee is made up of women of few resources – the majority of them live in a settlement called San Cayetano in the city of Capiatá. They are hardworking and enthusiastic, they value that the loan will give them the possibility of having working capital and above all the strengthen the friendship among them. The loan will be used to: buy clothing, fruit, vegetables, cosmetics, ingredients to make food, pitchers, pots, towels, etc. The group has a good amount of savings which will be deposited in a banking account. They all are thankful for the opportunity provided by the Fundación Paraguaya. They stand out for their solidarity and union that reigns among the Kuña Aty Committee. The work of each member is listed below: 1-Brígida B. - sells merchandise 2-Selva B. – sells clothing 3-Celia G. – sells clothing. 4-Hermogena T. – sells food 5-Sonia C. – sells clothing 6-Alfonsa I. – sells clothing 7-Alejandra O. – sells clothing. 8-Eugenia O. - sells cosmetics 9-Agueda V. (absent from the photo) – sells fruit and vegetables 10-Cheni A. – sells food 11-Estela Gómez – sells cosmetics. 12-Dora Estela – sells fruit 13-Olga P. – sells clothing 14-Liza Gómez - sells merchandise 15-Cristina M. – sells fruit

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, fruit, vegetables, cosmetics, ingredients to make food, pitchers, pots, towels, mops, etc.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika es originaria D. Cd. Solidaridad, Nuevo León, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. cométicos por catálogo. <

> Con la finalidad D. surtirse D. mercancías para atender las necesidades D. sus clientes solicita un préstamo por USD$300 a un plazo D. tres meses. <

> El inicio D. Erika en las ventas D. cosméticos por catálogo surgió como una inquietud transmitida por una D. sus amigas, al ella observar que este tipo D. productos generaban buenos resultados se animó a realizar ventas por si sola. Otros D. los factores que impulsaron a Erika en este tipo D. negocios fue el ser independiente y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos D. la familia. Erika cuenta con dos hijas pequeñas. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Erika para que pueda lograr apoyando a su esposo y cumplir con las necesidades D. su hogar! <

>
texts.en:
Erika is originally from Ciudad Solidaridad, Nuevo León, and today she sells cosmetics by catalogue. With the goal of stocking a variety of merchandise to meet the needs of her customers she is asking for a USD$300 loan for a period of three months. Erika began selling cosmetics by catalog when her friends expressed dissatisfaction, and upon noting that this type of product generated good income she decided to go into sales herself. Other factors that pushed Erika to this type of business was to be independents and help her husband with the household expenses. Erika has two small daughters. I invite you – let’s support Erika so that she will be able to support her husband and meet her household’s needs!

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock merchandise samples of cosmetics sold by catalog

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es:
Thelma es originaria de Montemorelos Nuevo León, y se ubica en el Rancho Reforma. Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en el que se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y snack. <

> Actualmente, ella solicita un préstamo por USD$325 para surtir mercancías para su negocioa un plazo de 4 meses. <

> Thelma inició hace dos años con la venta de snack afuera de la escuela a la que asisten sus dos hijos. La idea de emprender su negocio fue impulsada por los deseos de apoyar a su esposo en la generación de ingresos, para así contar con más recursos para las necesidades de su familia. Thelma es una persona que cree mucho en este tipo de préstamos dado que los utiliza para contar con un mayor surtido y poco a poco ha observado resultados positivos. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Thelma y ayudemos a que crezca su establecimiento! <

>
texts.en:
Thelma’s home town is Montemorelos Nuevo Leon and is located in Rancho Reforma. She has a small store where she sells used clothes and snacks. Currently she is requesting a loan of $325 to stock merchandise for her business. Thelma started 2 years ago selling snacks outside the school where her two children study, to help her husband’s income, in order to have more resources to cover the family’s expenses. Thelma believes in this kind of loans because she had used them to increase her stock and has obtained great results. We are inviting you to support Thelma and help her grow her business!

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock her business mainly used clothes and snacks

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El caballero Abraham V. es originario del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinanadega y se dedica al negocio de la agricultura con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar. Con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y se ha apoyado de los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel.

A pesar de la problemática económica que ha atravesado ha logrado con mucho sacrificio llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y es por eso que hoy en día se ha preocupado por mejorar su actividad de trabajo invirtiendo en los cultivos por medio de la asistencia técnica y de la compra de las hortalizas para su desarrollo.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los insumos para el cultivo. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Mr. Abraham V. is originally from the Somotillo municipality of the city of Chinandega and he is a farmer, which is how he supports his family which consists of his wife and two small school-aged children. With great sacrifice he has been able to be successful and has supported himself with the loans he has received from Ceprodel. In spite of the economic challenges that he has encountered, he has been able, with much sacrifice, to support his home and that is why today he is concerned about improving his work by investing in crops through technical assistance and by buying fertilizers for their development. Today he has approached Ceprodel for a loan that will permit him to buy supplies for his crops. With this loan it will benefit him as well as the family that he so loves.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for his crops

loans.name: Evert

texts.es:
<div align='justify'> 
La actividad de agricultura requiere de mucho esfuerzo por lo que el caballero Evert
texts.en: Farming requires a lot of effort which is why from a young age Mr. Evert

loans.use: Investment in his farming business

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
El caballero Modesto P. V. originario del municipio de Somotillo se dedica desde muy joven al negocio de ganadería el cual con mucho esfuerzo lo desarrolla todos los días trasladando el ganado a diferentes lugares para alimentarlos y a la vez para extraer la leche de las vaquillas.

De igual manera el señor Modesto también se dedica a la actividad agrícola en la siembra de granos básicos. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra del ganado e invertir en los cultivos. Por medio de este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Caballero Modesto P. V. is a native of the Municipality of Somotillo. Since he was very young he worked in the business of livestock farming, which with much effort every day, he successfully moves the herd to different places to eat and drink, and he sees to the extracting of the milk of the female cows. In the same way, Señor Modesto also has worked at agricultural activities, growing basic grains. Today, the reason he has approached CEPRODEL is to obtain a loan to purchase livestock and to invest in a crop. With this loan, he will be able to help his family that he loves a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Elizabeth R. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo al negocio de la agricultura como lo es la siembra de hortalizas y ajonjolí.

Es importante destacar que ella ha sido una dama que gracias a sus esfuerzos ha logrado mejorar la condición de vida de su pequeño hijo en edad escolar que tanto necesita de su apoyo. El motivo por el cual ella acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de las semillas para los cultivos y brindarle asistencia técnica a estos. Es necesario destacar que ella ha cancelado todos los anteriores créditos y se ha caracterizado por ser fiel cliente en la institución.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Elizabeth R. works with great effort on her farming business sewing vegetables and sesame. It is important to note that she has been a woman, thanks to her efforts, that has been able to improve her standard of living along with that of little school-aged son who is also in need of your support. The reason that she approached Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to buy seeds for her crops and provide technical assistance for her crops. It is necessary to note that she has repaid all previous loans and is considered to be a faithful client of this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina Q. es una dama que desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a la actividad económica de la agricultura en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella desde muy temprano todas las mañanas comienza su actividad económica y a medida que el día avanza en medio del cansancio y del sol siempre continúa esforzándose en su actividad.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de ajonjolí para la siembra y así continuar con su ardua labor en su municipio.
texts.en:
Guillermina Q. is a woman who has been farming in the Somotillo municipality of Chinandega city for a few years. It is important to note that from the early morning hours she begins her work and as the day advances even though tired and in the sun she always continues on with her work. Today she has approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy sesame seed to sew and inthsi way continue her arduous work in the community.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her farming buying seed

loans.name: Naqibllah

texts.en:
Naqibllah is a hard worker who operates a dress shop, a business he started seven years ago in Kabul. While he has a large number of clients, he is requesting a loan of $1075 for a term of 12 months to both expand his stock and enlarge his shop, thereby increasing his income and improving his family’s living conditions.

Naqibilah is happy about his relationship with Kiva and AFSG and hopes to open another shop in next few years. He would like to thank all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To expand his store stock.

loans.name: Qand Agha

texts.en:
Qand Agha A. is married father of three children. He lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a shop where he sells old things such as tires and old materials. First he buys items from different places in Kabul city then sells them to companies or exports them to Pakistan. He has a small business, but he always tries to make it big. To do this, he needs more money, therefore his need to take a loan.

Qand Agha has requested to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghans (US$1,075) to complete his stock and buy some things that he needs urgently to continue his business.

He is happy of this loan. He would like to say that this loan can make big changes in the life of a very hard worker and he wants to thank lenders that they help poor people in this country.

loans.use: To complete his stock.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is a businessman from Zaporozhye where he started his small enterprise about six years ago. He sells furniture accessories and furnishings in local marketplaces of his home town. Sergei rents two vending kiosks in the biggest markets of Zaporozhye. He also has a hired employee working as his salesman in one of these kiosks. Currently, he has about $4000 in merchandise. His net profit is about $600 a month.

Sergei has just opened a new vending facility. He is planning to stock it with all necessary merchandise and increase his sales as a result. He has perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine as he hasn't had a single late payment. We believe financial assistance will promote growth of his business and help him continue expanding his trade in the future.

loans.use: To stock his new vending facility.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina, married with two children, lives in Zaporozhye where she operates a typical small business selling men's and women's outer wear called "Voznesenovskyi" in the local market. Having worked in this field for eight years, she has gained much experience working with clients and handling business related challenges. Presently, Antonina has about $3000 in stock and earns about $400 in monthly profit.

Antonina is seeking a loan of $300 to purchase additional merchandise for this fall season. She is hoping to buy it wholesale and make a good profit in sales. Antonina is an entrepreneur who is constantly developing and growing as she experiments and introduces new and trendy clothing items. Her customers always leave her kiosk pleased with their purchases, and we are hoping to see this client continue to thrive and succeed in her business endeavors.

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase supplies for her cafeteria and grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase products and materials for her small salon.

loans.name: Thi Huong's Group

texts.vi:
chị Hoàng thị Hường Ms 09010010 năm nay 32 tuổi, hiện nay chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Gia đình chị có rất nhiều hoạt động chăn nuôi tạo thu nhập như : chăn nuôi gà đẻ trứng, vịt đẻ, ngan thịt, chăn nuôi lợn nái, lợn thịt, bán vật liệu xây dựng... Ngoài việc chăn nuôi ra, hàng ngày chồng chị còn là một chủ thầu xây dựng. Nên thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định từ 250.000 vnđ đến 300.000 vnđ / ngày,chị đã tham gia vay vốn qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt, đồng thời chị rất thích hình thức vay, trả này. Vì nó rất phù hợp với mục đích cũng như thu nhập của gia đình chị. Chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà, vịt. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • anh Lê đắc Chỉnh Ms 09010007 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để chăn nuôi.
  • anh Lê đắc Tuyên Ms 09010016 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để mua cám gà đẻ.
  • chị Lê thị Hằng Ms 09010012 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
  • chị Nguyễn thị Toán Ms 09010018 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ mua sắt vụn.( trả trong 25 tuần )
  • chị Nguyễn thị Hiền Ms 09010017 vay 2.006.000 VND để bổ sung mua cám lợn.( Trả trong 25 tuần )

loans.use: vốn vay chăn nuôi

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Bình năm nay 45 tuổi. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Từ năm 2005 đến nay ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị Bình còn đầu tư vốn để mở cửa hàng kinh doanh điện tử và Internet. Hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Bình is 45 years old. In 1996, she joined the TYM Fund and got a loan to put towards raising livestock. Since 2005, in addition to raising livestock, her family established a computer store and internet cafe. Currently, the family's income is 5,000,000 VND per month. For this loan, she hopes to get 19,000,000 VND to invest in the business of rearing pigs and chicken.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and chicken

loans.name: Duc

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Đức năm nay 38 tuổi. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi. Đến nay, ngoài chăn nuôi gia đình chị còn đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá, cây cảnh. Hiện tại thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 6.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào kinh doanh
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Duc is 38 yrs old. In 1996 she joined the fund and borrowed her first loan to raise pigs. Presently, in addition to raising pigs, she also invested in a general store and selling plants. Her family's income is 345.00 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 1150.00 USD to invest and carry on her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 45 tuổi. Gia đình chị hiện có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Năm 1996 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại gia đình chị L. đang chăn nuôi vịt, cá và trồng cây ăn quả  theo mô hình trang trại hàng tháng cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị xin vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và mua thêm cá giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L. is 45 years old. She has two grown children. In 1996, she joined the TYM Fund and received a loan to invest in raising livestock. Today, Mrs. L.'s family is raising pigs, fish, and growing fruit-bearing trees. Depending on conditions at the farm, their month income can be 5,000,000 VND. For this loan cycle, her family has requested 15,000,000 VND to invest in raising egg-producing ducks and to buy more fish to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising ducks and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business by adding jewelry and pants.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị S. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 1.000.000đ để sử dụng buôn bán hàng khô tại chợ. Sau đó chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi vịt đẻ và lợn nái. Hiện tại thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị S. is a TYM fund member since 2001. Her first loan of 1.000.000 VND was used to buy/trade dry food at the market. After that she decided to to switch to raising egg laying ducks and pigs. Today her family income is 4.000.000 VND a month. She is seeking a loan of 19.000.000 VND to expand her operations, increase her revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Thieu

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thiệu tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 500.000đ và sử dụng vào chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn sau chị xin vay vốn để đầu tư vào mua máy say sát gạo phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hiện tại công việc chăn nuôi, kinh doanh của gia đình chị cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 18.000.000 để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và buôn bán gạo.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Thieu joined the Fund in 1997. For her first loan she borrowed 30.00 and invested in raising pigs. Her subsequent loans were used to invest in buying a rice grinding machine to meet the demand of the local community. Her income from raising pigs and her business average 174.00 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 1100.00 USD to invest in raising pigs and buying rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising, Business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thư tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 500.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tăng T. nhập cho gia đình. Đến năm 2000 gia đình chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng điện tử, điện lạnh. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang có rất nhiều T.ận lợi cho T. nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 19.000.000đ để đầu tư vào công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thư has been a participant of the TYM Fund since 1997. Her first loan was for 500,000 VND to put towards raising livestock, which bumped the family's income. Then in 2000, her family borrowed a loan to invest in a home appliances retail business. Their retail business is successful, giving them 5,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, she hopes to borrow 19,000,000 VND to re-invest in their family's retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail Business: Home Appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a range of products to restock her mini-market.

loans.name: Agalar

texts.en: Agalar is married and has three children. He has been farming for five years. He lives in Khachmaz town. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings to increase his business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.ru:
Хашимова Зухра 1983 года рождения. Предпринимательством занимается пять лет и на данный момент торгует мужскими одеждами.  Местом ее деятельности является рынок «Шохмансур», магазин «Наргис» города Душанбе. В ее ассортименте большой выбор мужских летних и демисезонных футболок и накидок из хлопчатобумажных и маячных материалов производство Китая и Турции. Она закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая и Турции и мечтает сама ездить за товарами в эти города. 
Зухра узнала о программе Кива от подруги которая тоже участвовала в этой программе и хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zukhra K. was born in 1983. She has been an entrepreneur for five years and currently trades in men’s clothing. She works out of a shop named Nargis at the Shokhmansur market in the city of Dushanbe. Her inventory includes a large variety of men’s summer and cool-weather t-shirts, as well as cotton and knitted jerseys manufactured in China and Turkey. She buys her wares from suppliers in China and Turkey and dreams of traveling to their cities to make purchases. Zukhra found out about the Kiva program from friends who had also participated and she wishes to take out a loan in the amount of $1175 (4000 somoni) to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing, t-shirts, and sweaters

loans.name: Gasim

texts.en: This young man has been in the cafe business for three years. He lives in Khachmaz town. Gasim is single. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary things for improving his cafe business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for improving his cafe business.

loans.name: Jamahon

texts.ru:
Косимов Джаъмахон, ему 24 лет, женат. Предпринимательством занимается пять лет и на данный момент торгует мужскими одеждами.  Торгует на рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. В его ассортименте большой выбор спортивной одежды, футболки, трико, спортивные костюмы хлопчатобумажных и маячных материалов производство Китая и Турции. Он закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая и Турции. 
Джаъмахон хочет закупить сезонный товар и желает участвовать в программе Кива, чтоб получить денежные средства для расширения бизнеса в сумме 4000 сомони.
texts.en:
Jamahon K. is 24 years old and married. He has been an entrepreneur for five years and currently deals in men’s clothing at the Korvon market in the city of Dushanbe. His inventory includes a wide selection of sportswear, t-shirts, stretch pants, and cotton and jersey sets manufactured in China and Turkey. He buys his wares from suppliers in China and Turkey. Jamahon wants to purchase seasonal goods and wishes to participate in Kiva’s program in order to acquire the financial means to expand his business, the sum of $1175 (4000 somoni).

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal sportswear

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.en:
Amirkhon K., 29, is married and has two children. As a selfless father and responsible head of the household, eight years ago Amirkhon decided to dedicate himself to raising livestock after gaining experience working on a livestock ranch. He plans to keep raising livestock and to acquire even more. He is now requesting a loan of $1000 that will allow him to purchase more food for the normal development and competitiveness of his cattle. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months.

He thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed.

loans.name: Kimyo

texts.en:
Kimyo S. is a 43-year-old mother whose husband has no fixed income. She has been processing and selling dried apricots for the past two years, using all of her income to care for her two children and provide for their education.

Her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her, and because her business is doing so well, Kimyo is requesting $800 for the term of nine months. She is going to spend the money purchasing and processing dried apricots in order to increase the volume of her sales. With your help this will be possible.

Kimyo expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase and process dried apricots in order to increase her volume of sales.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en: Sevda (her father is pictured) lives in Khachmaz town. She is married and has one child. Sevda has been farming for three years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy seedlings for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Latifa's Hakuna Kulala Group

texts.en:
Latifa is 28 years old and married with two children, who are six years old and just two months. Since 2007, she has owned a small salon and has also been a chips seller. She works every day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Latifa is now looking for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling coconuts, firewood, charcoal, chips, clothing, and bites.

loans.use: To expand her salon and chips business.

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en:
Zabibu is 38 years old and married with two children, who are eight and five years old. She has been a chips and powder seller since 2007. She works every day from 7 am to 3 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Zabibu is now looking for a loan to expand her business and also start a new business.

loans.use: To expand her chips business and to start a new one.

loans.name: Robiyajon

texts.en:
S. Robiyajon is 50 years old. She is married with four children. Robiyajon has always had a trying life. Supporting the large family was very difficult for her husband, that’s why she decided to start her own business. Struggling against the difficult life, Robiyajon learned processing dried fruits and cling-stone apricots six years ago. The business went successfully after it started. Thanks to this activity she could fight to provide for her family and educate her children, who today are working adults thanks to her example.

Today this friendly woman is requesting a loan of US$600 for the term of nine months. She wants to use this loan for purchasing more dried fruits due to great demand from her customers. Robiyajon and her family are sincerely thankful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing dried fruits for processing and further selling.

loans.name: Behija

texts.en:
Behija Babajić, born in 1950, lives in Miričina with her husband. Although both retired,  they are busy on their land producing flowers, vegetables and fruits as well as raising livestock.  Behija and her husband are very satisfied with their lives, doing work they enjoy and being well remunerated. 

This is Behija’s first loan request in the amount of $750  to buy reserve food for the cows and calves because they are awaiting new calves. Behija and her husband wish to buy more calves and cows in the future and find good customers for them.

loans.use: To buy food for cattle.

loans.name: Zahrojon

texts.en:
S. Zahrojon is 55 years old. She’s married with four children. 

The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life have made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 5 years, she and her husband (who appears in the photo) have been purchasing the young cattle in the local market, fattening them, and selling them. 

Mrs. Zahrojon is a hard-working woman who has fought to provide for her family and to educate her children, who are working adults, thanks to her example. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. Mrs. Zahrojon wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. 

Now she is requesting a loan of $600 USD for 9 months to buy calves to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change her life.

loans.use: To buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is married with four children, who are 20, 17, 15, and 12 years old. Since 2005, she has owned a small restaurant and has also been a batik seller. She works every day at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Hidaya has successfully taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania that she used to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding new items to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding new items to her current stock.

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is 27 years old and married with a one year old child. She has been a shoes and handbag seller since 2005. She works at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Arafa has successfully taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now looking for a loan to buy more shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Musalamkhon

texts.en:
Musalamkhon S. is 39 years old, and is married with four children. For the past 7 years, she has been baking  “lepeshka,” the national Tajik bread. Musalamkhon works hard to earn an honest living. She gets up early and bakes lepeshka so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. 

Initially, Musalamkhon only baked the lepeshka, but never sold it herself. Gradually, the business expanded, her children grew up and, today, it is a family business that includes her adult children and a trading place in the market.

Today, Musalamkhon requests 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) in order to purchase flour and firewood for baking the lepeshka. She would like to ensure that she is ready to repay the loan in 10 months. 

Thanks to everyone for trusting and supporting her. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To buy flour and firewood for baking “lepeshka”

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.en:
Rasuljon U. is 49 years old and is married with two children. In addition to his wife and children, he also supports his parents.

Rasuljon is a very diligent and hard-working man. He uses his car to provide taxi services within the city of Isfara in northern Tajikistan. For the last three years, this business has supplied the main income for the family, allowing Rasuljon to improve the living conditions of his large family.

As with any business that generates the income for a family, Rasuljon's business requires some investments from time to time. Now, his car needs the thorough fixing. So Rasuljon is requesting $900 USD for 9 months. 

Having proved himself as a reliable client, Rasuljon promises to repay the current loan promptly and thanks all who are supporting him.

loans.use: Thorough fixing of the vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is 45 years old and married with five children between the ages of 3 and 18. Since 2002, she has owned a kiosk in which she sells clothing. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business.

In the past, Zena has successfully taken out two loans from BRAC Tanzania, which she used to expand her business. She is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities to further expand the shop.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to expand her business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 22 years old and married with a two year old child. Since 2007, she has been a clothing, soap, and charcoal seller. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Maryam has successfully taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she used to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes, soap, and charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, soap, and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавжуда, 1962 года рождения, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Чтобы пополнить семейный бюджет дополнительным доходом решил заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Он арендовал торговую точку на рынке для продажи разновидностей полотенца. Наращивая свой опыт предпринимателя вырученные деньги с бизнеса, пускал в оборот. В ее ассортименте большой выбор банных и кухонных полотенец, разновидность постельного белья и подушек. Также в продаже имеются подарочные наборы пастельного белья. Свои товары он закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Для увеличения ассортимента хочет участвовать в программе «Кива» и получить займ в сумме 2600 сомони для увеличения товаров.
texts.en:
Mavjuda, born in 1962, is married with four children. In order to earn additional income to supplement the family finances, she decided to go into business and rented an outlet at the market to sell a variety of linens. Building on her entrepreneurial experience she has reinvested money netted from the business. Her inventory includes a board selection of bath and kitchen towels, and a variety of bed linens and pillows. She also carries bedding gift sets. Mavjuda sells her goods at the Korvon wholesale market in the city of Dushanbe. In order to increase her inventory, she wishes to participate in the Kiva program, and take out a loan in the amount of $775 (2600 somoni) to add to her stock of goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bed linens

loans.name: Safia

texts.ru: Сафиямо, 1969 года рождения, замужем и имеет 6 детей. Начала свой бизнес с продажи зелени и овощей. Данный момент она торгует овощами и фруктами на рынке «Дехконбазар» Гисарского района. В ее ассортименте разновидность яблок, виноградов, персиков, перца и баклажана, помидоров и огурцов. Также в сезон в продаже имеются дыни, гранаты, хурмы, малины, клубники и т.д. Закупает свои товары с дехкан и у оптавиков из Узбекистана. Для увеличения ассортимента, закупа винограда и яблок  хочет участвовать в программе «Кива» и получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Born in 1969, Safia is married and has six children. She began her business selling vegetables, and currently sells both vegetables and fruit at the Gissar district Dekhkan market. Her inventory includes a variety of apples, grapes, peaches, peppers, eggplant, tomatoes and cucumbers. In addition, she sells melons, pomegranates, persimmons, raspberries, and strawberries, etc., when they are in season. She purchases her wares from Dekhkan and from Uzbekistan wholesalers. Safia wishes to participate in Kiva’s program to increase her inventory by purchasing grapes and apples. She would like a loan of $600 (2000 somoni) to increase the stock she has on hand.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grapes and apples

loans.name: Suvada

texts.en:
Suvada C. was born in 1965. She comes from Dobrinje near Visoko in central Bosnia and Herzegovina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is employed and he pays all of their expenses. He earns about 700 KM (Bosnia-Herzergovina Marks; about $520 USD), but it is not enough for living, especially because they have no house and they must build one. 

So, Suvada is busy in the field trying to earn more for their living. She is busy with farming and now is the right time to sow the fields. But Suvada has no money to buy seeds and she like to avoid planting in the autumn. So she has decided to take a loan of 1500 KM (about $1125 USD) from Women for Women International. 

Suvada hopes that she will have good products next year and that she will be able to sell a lot of her vegetables. She will use all of her profits to build her house, because her biggest wish is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Naomba

texts.en:
Naomba is 36 years old. She is married with 5 children, aged between 17 and 5. She is a chips, snacks, and charcoal seller. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Naomba has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to expand her business by increasing her present stock and to open a new business.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her present stock and to open a new business

loans.name: Asha's Tuwe Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Asha is 38 years old. She is married with 8 children, aged between 20 and 4. She has been a charcoal and coconut seller since 2003. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Asha now requests a loan to buy firewood and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling firewood, snacks, charcoal, juice, clothes, and shoes.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and coconuts for her business

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
C. Shahodat is 34 years old. She is married and has three children to whom she wishes to give the best. 

Shahodat’s husband is a mechanic, but his income is not enough to cover the family's expenses. That’s why Shahodat has been running her store for 10 years. She sells different kinds of food, accessories for girls, and women socks. 

Shahodat is very dynamic and cares for her family. She tries to give her family as much money as possible to cover the school expenses of her children, because she is dreams that all of them will be well educated. 

Today Shahodat wants to expand her business and to increase her working capital for purchasing new goods to sell. For this purpose, she requests 3700 Somoni ($1100 USD) for 6 months. She has borrowed from IMON several times before and has demonstrated that she is a reliable client. Shahodat promises to manage this loan without any violations.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy new goods to sell.

loans.name: Salma's Atoae Mola Group

texts.en:
Salma is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 11, 8, and 2. She has been a firewood and juice seller since 2003. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salma is now seeking a loan to buy more firewood and juice items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Amina, Saidat, and Fatma.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and juice items for her business

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Jitahidi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 10, 8, and 1. She has been a clothing and home utensil seller since March 2008. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanaisha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mwanaisha is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and home utensil products for the expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Amina, who has a business selling clothes and juice.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and home utensil products for re-sale in order to exapand her business

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 38 years old, and she is married with 2 children, ages 6 and 3. She has run her own shop since 2004. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 3:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Nuru is now looking for a loan to buy more commodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 23 years old, and she is divorced with 2 children, ages 5 and 3. She has been a clothing seller since 2005. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Khadija is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Kazija

texts.en:
Kazija is 45 years old, and she is married with 5 children. She has been a firewood and small fish seller since 2004. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

In the past, Kazija has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Kazija is now looking for a loan to buy firewood and small fish for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and small fish for re-sale

loans.name: Saliha

texts.en:
Saliha Sejdić is a 27-year-old married women. She has three children, ages 10, 8 and 6. Her husband is employed in a communal company. In addition, he collects secondary raw material for recycling. Saliha works that with him in this endeavor. 

After his work and on the weekends they pick up these materials and bringing them to the collecting place, which is very difficult without a car for transportation. Saliha and her husband think that it is a good business for them and that they have to buy some type car to transport the material faster. 

Saliha is asking for first loan of 1500 KM (about $1125 USD) from Women for Women International. It will be enough to buy an older second-hand car. Their work will be easier and they will be able to pick up more material, so they will earn more. All of this will make better chance for Saliha and her three children.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand transport car

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 49 years old, and she is divorced with 3 children, aged between 4 and 1. She has run her own shop since 1998. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

In the past, Zainab has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Zainab is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to expand her business

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 49 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 31, 20, and 17. She has been a charcoal, pots, and small fish seller since 1998. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM at her business.

In the past, Mwanahamis has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mwanahamis is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal for re-sale to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for re-sale to expand her business

loans.name: Maryam's Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Maryam is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children, ages 2, 4, and 3. She also takes care of 2 other children, ages 6 and 8. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Maryam is now requesting a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling snacks, mats, and clothes.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Kelen's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Kelen is married with 4 children, aged between 23 and 5. She has been a clothing seller since 2000. Every day she works from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Kelen is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes for re-sale to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with owning a salon and selling shoes and clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale to improve her business

loans.name: Ziada's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Ziada is 32 years old. She is divorced with 3 children, aged between 12 and 4. She has been a potato seller since 2007. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Ziada is now asking for a loan to buy more potatoes for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling potatoes, tomatoes, onions, perfumes, snacks, charcoal, and clothes.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 43 years old. She is divorced with 3 children, aged between 21 and 15. She has been a potato and onion seller since 2007. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 6:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Maryam is now looking for a loan to buy more potatoes and onions for her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and onions for her business

loans.name: Sherina

texts.en:
Sherina is 48 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 29 and 15 years old. She has been a clothes and food seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 7:15am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Sherina is now looking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is 36 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 15 and 6 years old. She has been a tearcher and stationery shop owner since 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 5:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Suzana is now requesting a loan to buy more items to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Hamisa is widow with 3 children ages between 38 and 20 years old. She has been a khanga and breads seller in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Hamisa now seeking for a loan to buy more khanga and breads for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and breads for re-sale.

loans.name: Fatma's Bites Seller Group

texts.en:
Fatma is married and has three children who are between 12 and 21 years of age. She has been a bites (snacks) seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Fatma is requesting a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling charcoal and soft drinks.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia A. is 40 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 3 and 18. She has been selling clothes and porridge since 2000. Every day, she works from 7:30am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Shadia is applying for a loan to improve her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, married with one child aged 18, has operated her own shop since 2005. Working everyday from 7:30 a.m. to 10 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Halima is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for the expansion of her business,

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, 25, is married and has a one-year-old child. She has been a decorations and clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 4.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Amina now looking for a loan to buy more decoration items and clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more decorations items and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira K. is 44 year old and is married with two adorable daughters. Tahira raises cattle for meat production. She has been breeding cattle for about 10 years. Currently, she has three head of cattle in her household. The business is successful and generates a stable income, allowing Tahira to support her family. Her husband and daughters help Tahira look after the cattle. Also, her husband sells the cattle they raise at the local livestock bazaar. 

Now, she is planning to purchase more cattle. For this purpose, she requests $1000 USD. Borrowing for the first time, Tahira promises to be accurate when repaying the loan and thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Hamisa

texts.en:
Hamisa is widow with three adult children. She became a khanga (a brightly colored piece of cloth that many East African women wear over their skirts while working in the fields) and bread seller in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Hamisa is seeking a loan to buy more khanga and bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy more khanga and bread.

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil J. is a 26-year-old man who works as a butcher and has a market stall for selling meat in the local bazaar. He has had experience in this field since 2002. He is married and has 3 children. Selling meat is the only source of income in his family and Fazil tries very hard to be a very good and polite with clients. That’s why his butcher shop is always full of people. 

He would like to expand his business, so he needs $1200 USD. He will use this loan to purchase a good place in the bazaar and a refrigerator to keep more meat fresh for a longer period. His business sustainability is in your hands!

loans.use: To purchase a good place in the bazaar and a refrigerator to keep more fresh meat for a longer period

loans.name: Amrah

texts.en:
Amrah A. is 34 years old.

Amrah is a cattleman, and has been in this business since 2002. Before that time, he used to help his father in his field. Because he had been trained by his father, after he served in the army, he purchased cattle to raise. Currently, he has one cow with calf. The business is quite stable and generates the primary income for the family.

Now, Amrah is planning to purchase three calves and fodder. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $1000 USD. This is the first loan for Amrah and he promises not to let down those who have trusted and supported him.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar A. is 33 years old and is married with one son. Bakhtiyar is a cattleman. He has been raising cattle for about 9 years. He works hard. His son is getting older and their needs are growing. He dreams of being able to provide his son and future children with everything they need. 

His business is quite stable and generates the main income for the family, but does not generate enough to expand the current business. He requests $1200 USD to purchase one cow and two calves. This is Bakhtiyar's first loan. He thanks all who support him for their trust, and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Elmeddin

texts.en:
Elmeddin R. is 23 year old. Elmeddin has been working in the livestock sector since he was 15 years old. Currently he has two cows. His main source of income is selling dairy products, such as milk and yoghurt. His mother helps him in the business. 

The business generates the main income for the family. His father is on pension and he needs special care and medicine. That’s why he is not helping in currently business, althought he is always ready to give advice to his son. 

Elmeddin applied for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase one cow, one calf, and fodder. This is a first loan for Elmeddin and he is sure he will be able to pay it back on time. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase one cow, one calf, and fodder

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar I. is 42 years old. He is married with three children. Ilgar has been a cattleman for 20 years. He buys, raises, and sells cattle in the local animal market. He has an education in accounting, but he could not find a job and decided instead to open his business Currently his main source of income is dairy sale and cattle breeding. The business is successfully generating a considerable amount of income for the family. It also helps improve the living conditions of the family. 

Ilgar is requesting $1200 USD for 15 months. The loan will be used to purchase one cow and two calves. He thanks everyone who is supporting him.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en:
Novruz A.  is 57 years old and is married with 3 children. Novruz sells milk and yoghurt to the local people. He started a dairy and poultry business in 1982. 

The cow is kept in the house and it took a lot of effort and care by Novruz before it could give milk. Every day, he gets up early in the morning in order to feed the cow; all day until late at night Novruz is busy looking after the cow and his chickens, which are also part of his income. The business is the main source of income for the family. 

Novruz has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase two cows. This is a first loan for Novruz. He thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be very accurate when managing the loan.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman A. is a 47-year-old cattleman who is married with two sons. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Telman has been associated with this business since childhood. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them.The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Telman gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals. And alll day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle.

Telman says that he works with only one aim in mind -- to provide his two sons with proper education. 

Now, Telman would like to expand his business and purchase one cow and two calves. For this purpose, he has applied for $1200 USD and, with your help, he hopes to reach his aim.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Hijat's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Hijat is 22 years old.She is married with 3 children, ages between 6 and 2 years old. She has been a bites (snacks) and juice seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 9:30 am to 7 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Hijat is now looking for a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Khadija, who also has a business dealing with chips and bread sales.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 43 years old, divorced with three children aged between 12 and 20. She has been a food seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Khadija is now looking for a loan to improve her business by buying more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To improve her business by buying more food items like rice, maize flour,meat,vegetables and bananas.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin was born in 1978. He is single, and he has been selling clothes for 10 years. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy clothes to increase his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi N. is 46 year old, is married, and has two children. His parents also live in his house. He has a cattle business in which he breeds cattle and sells two of them every two or three months. In addition, Vidadi rents land to grow fodder for the cattle. Vidadi`s business is stable and provides the main income for his  family. Vidadi is applying for a loan for the first time. He requests $1200 USD to purchase four calves.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Nadège

texts.fr: Madame Nadège P. est née à Lomé le 29/01/1977. Commerçante, elle vit avec son  mari et leur quatre 04 enfants. Ils habitent le quartier Kégué. Elle est spécialisée dans le commerce de pagnes et la confection et  vente de trousseaux pour bébés. Elle sollicite ce  crédit pour faire une commande de pagnes et de tissus pour trousseaux  bébés dans le cadre  d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nadège P. was born in Lome on January 29, 1977. She is a shopkeeper and lives with her husband and their 4 children. They live in the neighborhood of Kégué. Her specialty is the retail of pagnes (traditional wrap around fabric) and the making and sale of baby clothing. She is requesting this loan to make an order of pagnes and fabric to make baby clothes in order to increase her revenue and to meet her customers' demand.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of pagnes (traditional wrap around fabric) and sale of homemade baby clothes

loans.name: Fatali

texts.en: Fatali Y. is a 45 year old man and is married with 2 children. His main activity is selling spare parts.
