He opened his shop in 1999 and, since that time, it has been the main financial source for his family. He applied for $1200 USD to diversify the products he sells, and increase his inventory.

loans.use: to diversify the products he sells and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Tovha

texts.en: Tovha H. is a 55-year-old pharmacist who works in a drug store. Tovha loves her job, which consists of helping people select and purchase the right medicines. She has long dreamed of opening her own drug store, and some time ago, she began saving to make this possible. She now has enough money to strike out on her own if she can secure additional support in the form of a loan. She would like to borrow $1200 USD to increase number of medicine she sells. She would like to thank everyone who chooses to support her.

loans.use: To increase number of medicines she sells

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Né le 15/12/1979 à Mission Tové, Koffi L. est marié et père d’un 01 enfant. Ils vivent dans le quartier Forever. Sa femme est ménagère. Frigoriste de profession, L. Koffi sollicite ce crédit pour ouvrir un atelier et s’équiper en matériels de travail afin de  s’installer et travailler dans les normes de sa profession.
texts.en:
Born on December 15, 1979 in Mission Tové, Koffi L. is married and the father of one child. They live in the Forever district. His wife takes care of the home. Working professionally in the domain of refrigeriation, he is requesting this loan to open a workshop and to get equipped with work materials in order to become established and to work normally in his profession.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To open a refrigeration workshop and to buy work materials

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil A. is a 19 year old trader who sells men's clothes. He is a hard-working man struggling to feed his large family consisting of his elderly parents and two older brothers who are studying at school. 

Adil has a trading place in the central local market in the city of Sabirabad. All of the fabric is bought from the neighboring town of Baku, the capital of country. Adil is trying to have a wide range of goods to better meet the requirements and different levels of income of his customers. 

Today, Adil feels that with more working capital his business could generate more income, so he is asking for a loan of $1000 USD. He believes that this loan will improve not only his business, but also his family's living standards. Let's help this incredible young man give his family a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Nevenka

texts.en:
Nevenka Jovanović was born in 1978. She lives in Lipac near Doboj. She is married and is mother of  three children. Her husband has constant work and Nevenka works two times a week. She earns 150 KM (Bosnia-Herzegovina convertible marks; about $110 USD) cleaning a church. 

Nevenka is a very active women. She is very busy in her garden, she has poultry and pigs, but she has no reserves of foods for her animals to go through winter time. Nevenka has decided to take her first loan of 600 KM (~ $450 USD) from Women for Women International. She will use this loan to buy some poultry and reserves of food for poultry. This is her way to have enough food for her family. She hopes that her little farm will be profitable.

loans.use: To buy poultry and food for poultry

loans.name: God Help Group

texts.en: This group is called God Help. It members include Kadiatu K. (left) and Charles B.. They have businesses in Makeni. They have been receiving loans from SMT for more than two years now. Through these loans they get from Kiva (through SMT), these entrepreneurs are able to remain in business and sustain themselves. However, they still need new loans to enable them to enhance their businesses. They are thus requesting a loan of Le 1,600,000. Kadiatu, 37, is the leader of the group. She was born in Magoreh village, seven miles from Makeni. She is married and has five children. Her husband is also a businessman. Kadiatu has sold dried fish for the past 10 years. She buys fish in a village called Tombo which is about 10 miles from Freetown. With this loan, Kadiatu is expecting an increase in her profits, which will enable her to provide better for her children.  One of the great challenges Kadiatu faces as a dried fish seller is that they sometimes unknowingly buy a basket of fish that is mixed with some rotten ones. And when this happens, they have to throw away the rotten fish, which causes losses in her business.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en:
Sevinj A. is a 21-year-old woman who works as sales person in local medicine store. She has been in this business since 2005. Because she is from very poor family, she was pushed to start working at a very early age. Now she is only 21, but she is quite an experienced young lady. She also attended courses in medicine to be better prepared for her current job. 

After being in this business for such a long time, Sevinj has decided to open her own business. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of $1000 USD. She will use this loan to open a store on her own corner, where she will be selling different kinds of medicine. Your help and support will be very much appreciated.

loans.use: To open her own pharmacy

loans.name: Zowadan Koffi

texts.fr: Né le 31/12/1939 à  Mission Tové, Mr H. Zowadan Koffi est marié et père de dix 10 enfants. Sa femme est cultivatrice. Ils habitent le quartier Djosse Kpodji. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter et installer un moulin dans quartier qui souffre du manque  d’un moulin à grain. Ce crédit lui permettra d'avoir un revenu substantiel pour faire face aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born on December 31, 1939 in Mission Tové, Mr. Zowadan Koffi H. is married and the father of 10 children. His wife is a farmer. They live in the Djosse Kpodji district. He is requesting this loan to buy and install a mill in this neighborhood which suffers from a lack of a mill to grind grain. This loan will permit him to have a substantial income to cater for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and installation of a mill for grain

loans.name: Gulnare

texts.en:
Gulnare H. is a 51-year-old woman who is married and has five children. She has a store in the local bazaar where she sells home supplies, such as as kettles, tea trays, and kitchen clocks. She tries very hard to meet her family's needs, because it is very hard to keep such a large family. Her husband helps by purchasing new supplies, which he brings from Baku every week. She dreams of providing a good education for her children. 

Gulnare has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase more supplies and increase her income. Let’s do our best to support her in her very hard life!

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Daliborka

texts.en: Daliborka Jovanović was born in 1979. She lives in the village of Lipac near Doboj. She has two children. Unfortunately, her husband died last year. He had supported their family, and they now live on his retirement of 150 KM ($112 USD). Fortunately, Daliborka has her garden and a field where she grows different kinds of vegetables, some of which she uses to feed her family and the rest she sells. Daliborka wants to produce more vegetables for selling, so she decided to take out her first loan from Women for Women International in the amount of 600 KM ($450 USD). She will use this loan to buy seeds for autumn sowing. Daliborka hopes that she will be able to earn enough money to pay all her family’s expenses.

loans.use: To buy a seeds

loans.name: Ayéva Marie

texts.fr: Ayéva Marie K. est née le 20.04 1967 à Amégnran. Elle est marié et a sept (07)  enfants. Son mari est gérant d’une pharmacie villageoise. Ils habitent un petit village à l’intérieur du TOGO environ 70 km de Lomé la capitale appelé Zafi Hetchavi. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour faire le commerce du pétrole lampant qui est très recherché dans le village. Elle compte sur ce financement pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayéva Marie K. was born on April 20, 1967, in Amégnran. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is the manager of the village pharmacy. They live in a little village called Zafi Hetchavi in the interior of Togo, about 70 km from the capital Lomé. Mme K. is requesting this loan to trade kerosene, which is in great demand in the village. She is counting on this financing to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell kerosene

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 30-year-old single woman who lives in a small village in the Mount Lebanon region. Dalal has a beauty shop and is trained in cosmetics and makeup application. Dalal's ambitions to expand her business led her to Al Majmoua, and she has requested a loan of $900 in order to purchase new tools that will enable her to provide a wider range of services for her customers. With this loan, Dalal will be able to grow her business and provide a better standard of living for her family. This is the first time Dalal has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her salon

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin M. is a 21-year-old market vendor. Since 2004, he has bee selling men's clothing in the local market. Because his mother is a housekeeper, his business is the only source of income for his family, which consist of his elderly parents, a younger brother and sisters. For this reason, he works hard to bring sustenance back to his home. Elchin wants to get married and have children, but he needs to improve his life conditions first.

To grow his business, Elchin is requesting a loan of $1200 USD. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise so he can offer a wider selection to his customers and increase his income. With the rotation of supplies in his business, he plans to repay the loan within 15 months. The well-being of  Elchin's family and his business are in your hands. Elchin and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase men's clothing for the winter season to sell

loans.name: Rhoda Group

texts.en:
These are Alimany B. and Zainab B.. (Other members of the group are now receiving loans from SMT as individual clients.) They named their group Rhoda. They have been with SMT for over five years now. Their previous loan with SMT was Le 1,000,000.00. This loan was a great help to these entrepreneurs. These people's businesses have been growing as a result of the continuous access to loans they have been getting from SMT. But they still need new loans as they are aware of the fact that it is the continuous access to financial services that can eradicate or reduce poverty.

Alimany B. is the leader of this group. Alimany owns a provisions shop at Pamlap, a village around the outskirts of Makeni. He has been in his current business for over 15 years now. Alimany was born in Binkolo, a village 7 miles from Makeni. He is 47, married with 4 children. Two of his children are in secondary school and the other two are in primary school. His previous loans with SMT helped Alimany a great deal. Out of the proceeds of his business, he was able to solve his numerous problems. He could send his children to school, attend to them when they fall sick, feed and clothe them. Though he faces some few challenges in his business, like that of bad debtors, Alimany is nevertheless expecting a lot of improvements in his life with this new loan. His immediate goal he told me is to start building himself and his family a house. Even if he can not accomplish this desire now, he continued, with continuous loans from SMT, Alimany is optimistic that he will be able to accomplish his goal.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Ndèye Salimatou

texts.fr: Ndèye Salimatou S., 38 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines d’arachide pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Ndèye Salimatou S., 38, married and raising 5 children, has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade for 6 years. She wants to purchase peanuts to make into peanut butter for sale. The income from her business will allow her to help support her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment./b>

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman N. is 34 year old and is married with two sons. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells women's clothes and shoes. Elman's family is actively involved in helping with the business. Elman is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to become a successful entrepreneur. Elman`s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that, someday, they'll become successful entrepreneurs themselves. We believe his perseverance and clear vision are key factors in the success of his small business.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Zahar

texts.en: Zaher is 35 years old and the father of one child. Zaher lives in the Mount Lebanon region, near the town of Aley. A hairdresser by trade, Zaher owns a salon for women. Zaher believes that a confident vision for the future is essential to the success of his business, and has recently asked for a loan of $1000 improve the decoration of his salon, as well as to purchase several new salon chairs. Zaher is confident that these improvements will increase his client flow. Over his past four loan cycles, Zaher's honesty and punctuality with his payments have helped him earn the trust of Al Majmou's loan analysts.

loans.use: To help fund the purchase of new salon chairs and decoration for Zahar's salon.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa N. is a 43 year old man who owns a veterinary medicine shop. He started his business in 1992. Musa is married and has 2 children. It is very hard to meet his family's financial needs, so Musa has applied for a loan of $1000 USD to expand his current business.

loans.use: To expand his current business.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Né le 18/11/1983 à Vogan, Mr Koffi A. est marié  et père de famille avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. Sa femme est une tresseuse. Ils habitent le quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il sollicite ce crédit pour ouvrir un studio de photo et de reportage vidéo. C'est un jeun homme très dynamique qui mérite d'être appuyé.
texts.en:
Born on November 18, 1983 in Vogan, Mr. Koffi A. is married and raising 4 children. His wife does hair braiding. They live in the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé. He is asking for this loan to open a photography and videography studio. He is a very dynamic young man who merits support.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a photography and videography studio

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim S. is a 45-year-old man who is married with 2 children. He has owned his veterinary medicine shop since 2000. This is very popular product among farmers, because majority of people keep livestock and need to give them injections every two to three months. He needs $1200 USD to increase number of medicines that he sells.

loans.use: To increase number of medicine he sells.

loans.name: Haisam

texts.en: Haisam is 28 years old and the father of one child. He lives in the town of Aley, situated atop Mount Lebanon. In Aley, Haisam owns an auto-body repair shop and has asked for a loan of $1000 to help purchase new tools. Haisam's current tools are outdated and force him to spend long periods of time doing work that could be finished quickly. His new instruments will allow him to service more customers in less time, hopefully increasing his business's profitability. This will be Haisam's second loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 47, is married and has seven children between the ages of 3 and 30. She has been a bites (snacks) seller since 1991. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

Asha is requesting a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Wahida's Wanawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Wahida is 27 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 7 and 2. She has sold charcoal, bites (snacks), and juice since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Wahida is looking for a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Farida, who sells with perfumes.

loans.use: To improve her businesss.

loans.name: Diarry

texts.fr: Diarry K., 49 ans, veuve avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade depuis 3 ans. Elle veut acheter et revendre des tissus teintés. Son activité secondaire est la vente de pâte d’arachide qu’elle produit par la transformation des graines qu’elle achète sur le marché. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charges les besoins de sa famille. <b>Diarry sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Diarry K. is a 49-year-old widow with five children under her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Vivane Wade for three years. She wants to purchase and resell dyed fabrics. Her other job consists of selling peanut butter which she makes with peanuts that she buys at the market. Her income allows her to support her family. Ms. K. is requesting a loan which will be repaid in one lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling of dyed fabrics and peanut butter

texts.en:
Asadulla N. is a 40 year old father of two children. Asadulla opened his business selling clothing for men four years ago to support his family. Sacrificial and hardworking, he supports not only his two children, but his elderly parents as well.

Asadulla has invested countless hours and efforts to develop his business and establish a strong client base. Now his wife is helping him with the business. With the beginning of a new winter season, Asdaulla wants to add new seasonal stock to his inventory. He applied for $1200 USD. With this loan, he will be able to make a good profit by having the right inventory in stock to meet demand as the season changes.

Asadulla and his friendly family would like to express their gratitude for everyone supporting him.

loans.use: to buy men's clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Sidibé a 50 ans et vit avec ses sept( 7) enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à Sogomougou un des quartiers de la ville de koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant jamais été à l’école comme la plupart des femmes de son âge, Madame Assitan Sidibé fut initiée aux activités commerciales depuis sa tendre enfance par sa mère. Evoluant dans le secteur de la nourriture, notamment la vente de la pâte d’arachide, elle a un grand sens des affaires grâce à une trentaine d’année expérience accumulée dans l’exercice de cette activité. Pour obtenir de la pâte d’arachide, les graines d’arachides sont triées, grillées dans un four (très souvant frabriqué localement), épluchées, vannées puis amenées au moulin (pour avoir la pâte). La pâte ainsi obtenue est mise dans des seaux en plastiques.
Pour élargir son activité Assitan Sidibé decida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il ya de cela  4 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés ; elle est à son troisième prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1.000 kg d’arachides et  50 seaux en plastique (pour le conditionnement de sa pâte d’arachide). Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Koutiala auprès des commerçants grossistes faisant le stockage des céréales. Elle vend sa production en détail, au comptant et à crédit à son domicile et dans les différents services à une clientèle généralement composée de femmes (ménagères et revendeuses) et de salariés. Son  cycle d’activité (achat, transformation et vente) est d’un mois.
En raison de la qualité de sa pâte d’arachide, Madame Assitan Sidibé jouit d’une grande réputation dans cette activité de transformation des graines d’arachide en pâte. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout auprès des revendeurs et des familles désireuses de faire un stock afin de palier  aux fluctuations de prix.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.Dans l’avenir , elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique afin de faire le grosssiste dans la vente de la pâte d’arachide.
texts.en:
Ms. Assitan Sidibé is 50 years old and lives with her seven children and her husband in a nuclear family in Sogomougou, one of the districts of the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Never having gone to school, as is true for most women of her age, she was initiated into commercial work at a tender age by her mother. Developing in the food sector, notably in selling peanut butter, she has much business sense, thanks to 30 years of experience accumulated through doing this work. To obtain peanut butter, the peanuts are sorted, roasted in an oven (very often built locally), peeled, winnowed, and then taken to the mill (for converting into a paste). The peanut butter obtained in this way is then put into plastic buckets. To expand her business, she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. After four solidarity loans (group loans) that were all correctly repaid, she is on her third individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 1,000 kg of peanuts and 50 plastic buckets (for conditioning the peanut butter). She gets her supplies locally in Koutiala from wholesale merchants who stock grains. She sells her production at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, out of her home and with the difference public services, to customers generally composed of women (housewives and retailers) and salaried workers. Her business cycle (purchasing, production, and sales) is one month in length. Because of the quality of her peanut butter, Ms. Assitan Sidibé enjoys a great reputation in this business of making peanut butter. She receives many orders, especially from retailers and from families wanting to stock up against price fluctuations. She intends to realize a profit of 90,000 francs per month that she envisions using for covering the loan interest and for helping with the day-to-day expenses of the family. In the future, her ambition is to open a shop to become a peanut butter wholesaler.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz A. is 36 year old and is married with two children. He sells men's clothes. The store is located in the central local market and has been open for 8 years. 

In order to have a wide range of goods for any taste and any price, Ramiz travels every month to the capital of country, Baku, to purchase new goods. While he travels, Ramiz’s wife helps him sell in the market. 

Ramiz has managed to increase his clientele, but he is not able to fully meet their demands. He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD. He would like to increase his inventory to earn more income so that he can provide his children with a good education and a better future. Your generosity can help change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase men's clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Tamaraneh Traders Association Group

texts.en:
This group is called Tamaraneh Traders Association. Tamaraneh is a Temne word meaning "Let us help each other". They are business women in Makeni, the northern provincial headquarters town. They have been together as a group with SMT for the past three years

Previously, SMT loaned these women Le 600,000.00 each. This they have repaid successfully and are now requesting a new loan. The previous loan made a lot of impact on their lives, but they still need more loans to further empower themselves in their businesses.

Their leader is Kadiatu T. (on the right). Kadiatu was born in Port Loko, a town in the north of Sierra Leone. She is 44 years of age. She is married with three children. Two of her children are in primary school and the one is in secondary school. Both she and her husband are responsible for their schooling and welfare. For the past four years, Kadiatu has been in the local produce business (she sells items like palm-oil, ground nuts, rice, etc.). Through her business, Kadiatu is able to meet most of her financial needs.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Rehema's Tusitengane Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 18 and 5 years old. She has been a vegetable seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Rehema is now looking for a loan to buy more vegetables and bananas for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha, who has a business dealing with charcoal, firewood and coconut sales.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Marié et père d’un enfant, T. Koffi est né le 23/11/1983 à  Agbodjan Kopé dans la préfecture des Lacs. Sa conjointe est femme au foyer sans revenu. Ils habitent le quartier Dabara Kondji à Lomé. Il sollicite ce crédit pour ouvrir un magasin d’alimentation générale et vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques. Ce crédit lui permettra d'améliorer ses revenus et les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Married and the father of one child, Koffi T. was born on November 23, 1983 in Agbodjan Kopé in the Lakes Prefecture. His partner is a housewife who does not earn an income. They live in the Dabara Kondji district in Lomé. He is requesting this loan to open a little general store where he also plans to sell generic medicines. This loan will permit him to improve his income and the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a general store

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer A. is a 43-year-old man who lives with his wife and two adorable children in the small village of Saatli region. He sells women's clothing in the local bazaar. He started his business in 1996. He is not alone in his business; his wife actively helps him to sell clothes. 

Selling clothes is the only one financial source in his family. Azer goes to capital of Azerbaijan, Baku, to purchase new clothes every week. He has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase women clothes for winter season. 

Let's wish Azer good luck in new season!

loans.use: To purchase women's clothes for winter season

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 35 years old, married and has two children, ages 10 and 4. She has made a living selling charcoal and bread since 2003. Every day, she works from 7:15 a.m. to 2 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $25.

Zainab is looking to improve her business with a loan to buy more charcoal and bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and bread to sell.

loans.name: Akofa

texts.fr: Célibataire  et mère d’un enfant, Akofa K. est née le 02/10/1982 à Lomé. Elle habite le quartier Bè Ahligo . Elle a un salon de coiffure qui ne répond pas aux normes pour la satisfaction de ses clients et lui fournissant suffisamment de revenus pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et celui de son enfant. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’équiper en matériel de travail et en produits cosmétiques et rénover son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
A single mother with one child, Akofa K. was born on Oct 2, 1982 in Lomé. She lives in the Bè Ahligo district. She has a hairdressing salon that is unable to satisfy its customers or provide her with enough income to meet her own needs or those of her child. She is requesting this loan to equip herself with work materials and cosmetic products, and to renovate her hairdressing salon.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase work materials and renovate her hairdressing salon

loans.name: Djénébou

texts.fr:
Madame Djénébou T. est âgée de 33 ans et vit avec ses 5 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogame au troisième quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali.)
Elle se consacra très rapidement aux activités génératrices de revenus, notamment le commerce des articles de fête (tel les boucles d’oreilles). En plus elle vend aussi des trousseaux de clés, des habits et des chaussures. Elle a son étale sis au marché journalier du château de Ségou (situé au centre ville sur l’artère principale reliant Bamako au Burkina).
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de ses activités elle décida de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir bouclé 4 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous correctement remboursés avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 8 paquets de boucles d’oreilles (autrement appelés garanties en provenance de Doubaï) et 300 paires de chaussures auprès des grossistes spécialisés dans le domaine des articles de femmes à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) Disposées sur une table, les marchandises de Madame Djénébou sont vendues généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA. et ambitionne de se construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djénébou T. ís 33 years old and lives with her husband and five children in a monogamous family in the third district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She quickly dedicated herself to profitable activities, in particular the sale of party items such as earrings. She also sells key chains, clothing and shoes. She has set up a stall at Ségou’s daily Château market (located in the center of town on the main road linking Bamako to Burkina). Wishing to expand her business, she decided to work with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago now. Having successfully repaid four group loans (solidarity loans) with an association from her district, she is now on her second individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 8 packets of earrings (labeled as being guaranteed to come from Dubai) and 300 pairs of shoes from wholesalers who specialize in women’s items in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). Mrs. Dejénébou’s merchandise is laid out on a table and generally sold for cash to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 40,000 and her ambition is to build a home for herself.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy earrings and shoes

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa, 27, is married and has three children between the ages of two and eight. She has run her own shop since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Arafa is looking for a loan to buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Binasa

texts.en: Binasa K. is 59 years old. She is married and lives in Visoko, a little town near Sarajevo. Binasa lives with her husband who is employed. Binasa is a farmer who works a lot in the fields. Binasa wants to be prepared for autumn sowing so she decided to take a loan from Women for Women International (WWI) in amount of 1500 KM. This is not her first loan in WWI, every year she take a loan to invest in her business. She will rent one more field for sowing wheat. Binasa will extend her business and she will be happy to the extra work. Work gives her satisfaction and provides her and her husband with food to eat and to sell.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Hamisa's Mungu Mkubwa Group

texts.en:
Hamisa is 36 years old. She is divorced with 4 children, ages between 17 and 2 years old. She has been a clothing seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 9 am to 4:30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175  from her sales.

Hamisa now requesting  for a loan to improve her business by increasing her current stock.She will share this loan with her subgroup member Nuru, who also has  business dealing with clothing sales.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Hokéné

texts.fr: Née le 23/11/1986 à Aného, M. Hokéné est une célibataire avec un enfant à charge. Elle vit avec son enfant dans le quartier Forever à Lomé et travaille actuellement comme serveuse dans un bar de la place faute d’argent pour faire le commerce dans lequel elle excelle. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour faire des achats et la vente de produits cosmétiques et de chaussures pour reprendre son ancienne activité qu’est le commerce.
texts.en:
Hokene M. was born on November 23, 1986. She is single and is responsible for one child. She lives with her child in the Forever district of Lomé and is working as a waitress in a local bar to earn income to maintain her business, at which she excels. She is requesting this loan to purchase and sell cosmetic products and shoes to re-establish her former commercial business activity.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products and shoes

loans.name: Rauhia

texts.en:
Rauhia is 28 years old. She is divorced with 2 children aged 8 and 6 years old. She has been a bites seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 9:30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Rauhia is now looking for a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Asha's Mungu Muweza Group

texts.en:
Asha is 24 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 3 years old. She also takes care of one other person aged 26 years old. She has been a clothes and chicken seller since 2004. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 175 from her sales.

Asha is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and chickens for her businesses. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatma, MwanaK. M., Mgeni and MwanaK. M..

loans.use: To buy more clothes and chickens for her businesses

loans.name: Massaran

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Massaran D. est âgée de 32 ans. Célibataire avec un enfant, elle vit dans le quartier lafiabougou à Selingué (une des sous préfecture de Yanfolila troisième région administrative du Mali). Dès son jeune âge, elle démarre une activité génératrice de revenus notamment la vente de produits cosmétique. Malgré son courage et sa volonté de réussite, elle est rapidement confrontée à un problème de ressources financières. Pour résoudre cette difficulté, elle intégra un groupe de prêt solidaire de l’institution Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois (3) ans. Avec l’augmentation rapide de son commerce et de sa clientèle, elle passa au prêt individuel et est à son quatrième prêt. Sa boutique est située au bord de la route principale de Selingué et est bien achalandée. 

Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt beaucoup de flacons de parfum, de perruques et autres articles de beauté de femme pour anticiper les grosses ventes liées à la fête de ramadan et la rentrée scolaire. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako une fois par mois et vend à selingué dans son magasin au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes de selingué et celles des localités environnantes. Elle jouit d’une bonne réputation en raison de son expérience et de la maîtrise des techniques de commerce.

Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et désire à la longue instaurer un salon de coiffure qui est une demande pressante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Miss Massaran D., 32, is single and has one child. She lives in the Lafiabougou district in Selingué (one of the sous-prefectures of Yanfolila, third administrative region of Mali). Since her youth, she began earning money, notably by selling cosmetics. Despite her courage and will to succeed, she quickly ran into financial difficulties. To solve this problem, she joined in a group loan through Soro Yiriwaso 3 years ago. As her business and her clientele grew rapidly, she moved on to requesting an individual loan and is presently on her fourth loan. Her little shop is located on the main road of Selingué and is well-patronized.

With this loan she intends to buy a lot of bottles of perfume, wigs, and other beauty products so as to be ready for the increased sales around Ramadan and the new school year. She does her buying in Bamako once a month and makes her sales in Selingué in her shop, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of the women of Selingué and those coming from surrounding towns. She has a good reputation because of her experience and mastery of her business.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 95,000F CFA which she will use to increase her working capital and she would like to start up a beauty salon which is a pressing need for her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cosmetics and lingere to add to her stock

loans.name: Remza

texts.en:
Remza Halilović was born in 1986. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 1. Remza lives with her family in  Mahmutovićima near Kalesija. Her husband has constant work but he doesn`t earn much, only about 450 KM (~ $330 USD). It is not enough to pay all costs for his family. 

Remza and his husband are busy with farming. They produce several kinds of vegetables and they have a corn field so they can produce food for their cattle. 

Remza has borrowed from Women for Women International several times in the past. Every time that she has taken a loan, she invests the proceeds in her business, as she will this time. 

She has saved some money, but not enough to buy another cow, so Remza will use this loan of 1000 KM ($750 USD) to buy a cow. In this way Remza`s family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame Hawa T. est âgée de 43 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit avec son époux ses enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative du Mali).
Dès son plus jeune âge elle s’adonna aux activités génératrices de revenus pour aider ses parents à supporter les charges de la famille. Devenue majeure, elle opta depuis 15 ans pour le commerce du bois de construction. Installée au marché de Médine sur un des boulevards le plus fréquenté de la ville et étant la seule femme s’occupant de la vente des bois de la construction, Madame Hawa T. fait l’objet d’une curiosité et d’une notoriété hors du commun à Ségou.
Afin de mieux résister à la concurrence, dans un secteur dominé par les hommes, elle décida de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. Elle est à son deuxième prêt indivuduel, après avoir bouclé quatre prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) tous  correctement remboursés..
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt, pour acheter, 1.500 unités de bois de construction. à Zantiguila (un des marchés de bois situé aux abords d’une forêt classée) auprès d’exploitants forestiers agrées par le gouvernement du Mali. Avec une  clientèles constituée exclusivement de grossistes venant des grandes villes, Madame Hawa T. réalise ses ventes généralement au comptant et quelque rare fois à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice par cycle (qui dure en moyenne quatre semaines) de 100.000FCFA.qui la permettra de venir en aide à sa vieille mère.
texts.en:
Ms. Hawa T. is 43 years old and the mother of two. She lives with her husband and children in a monogamous family in the Médine district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). From her earliest years, she devoted herself to income-generating work to assist her parents in supporting her family. Once she became of age, she opted at the age of 15 to do commerce in lumber. Settled in at the Médine marketplace on one of the busiest boulevards in town, and being the only woman busy selling lumber, Ms. Hawa T. is a focus of curiosity and unusual fame in Ségou. In order to better stand up to the competition, in a sector dominated by men, she decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. She is on her second individual loan, after having settled four group loans (solidarity loans), which were all correctly repaid. She intends to use this loan to buy 1,500 pieces of lumber in Zantiguila (one of the marketplaces for lumber located on the edge of a closed forest) from woodsmen traders authorized by the government of Mali. With customers made up exclusively of wholesalers from big cities, Ms. Hawa T. generally makes her sales in cash and rarely on credit. She envisions realizing a profit per cycle (lasting four weeks on average) of 100,000 francs which enables her to come to the aid of her elderly mother

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for constructon

loans.name: Kazija's Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Kazija is 32 years old. She is married with 2 children, ages 6 and 1 year old. She has been a firewood and juice seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Kizija now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Farida, Mariam and Sharifa.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Balimaya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de trente cinq (35) ans et cinq (5) enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers monogames et résident toutes au quartier Odioumabougou à Ouéléssébougou (deuxième région administrative se la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parenté et d’affaire. Elles exercent la même activité à savoir la vente de miel.

En raison de la rentabilité de cette activité et de la forte demande du miel, elles décidèrent de se regrouper et adhérer au programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce prêt de 25.000 FCFA par membre, elles comptent acheter chacune 30 litres de miel. Elles s’approvisionnent chaque quinze (15) jours à Bougouni et vendent sur les marchés de la localité au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes amateurs de produits naturels.

Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice prévisionnel moyen de 12.000 FCFA par membre. Avec ce bénéfice, elles désirent après remboursement de l’intérêt du prêt, investir le reste dans leur affaire.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya group are married women with an average age of thirty five and five children. They come from monogamous homes and all live in the Odioumabougou neighborhood of Ouéléssébougou (a second-level administrative subdivision of the Republic of Mali). They met through relatives and business connections. They all work in the same business - selling honey.

For reasons of profitability and the high demand for honey, they decided to get together and join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. With this 25,000 FCFA ($56) loan per member, they each intend to buy 30 liters of honey. They stock up at Bougouni every fifteen days and sell the honey at local markets, for cash or credit, to a clientele of men and women who are fond of natural products.

They expect to make an average profit of 12,000 FCFA ($28) per member. After repaying the interest on the loan, they want to invest the remainder of this profit in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy honey

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 22. She has sold clothing since 2003. Daily, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Asha is requesting a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, 40, is divorced and has two children, ages 10 and 15. She has been a charcoal and bites (snack) seller since 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asha is looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasind her present stock.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado el comercio. Comenzó su negocio al verse en la necesidad de mantener a sus dos hijitos, hace 5 años empezó a buscar opciones par salir adelante, y lo encontró en la venta de zapatos por catalogo y con sus ahorros posteriormente puso su tienda y empezó a crecer y a tener un mayor ingreso combinando ambas actividades.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 1 mes para a tener un mayor surtido en su tienda y consecuentemente mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Juana launched her business because she has always liked to make deals. She started her business five years ago after looking for opportunities to get ahead, since she knew that she needed to support her two young children. She decided to sell shoes by catalog, and with her savings she later set up a store. The combination of these two activities has allowed her to grow and to earn a greater income.

She needs a loan of US $575, which she will use to buy a wider variety of goods for her store so that she can sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for store

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria inicio el negocio para proveerse de dinero para la manutención de sus hijos, ya que tuve que hacerse cargo de sus 4 hijos. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 5 años cuando decidió junto con una comadre a poner un estanquillo de venta de tacos, quedándose posteriormente sola con el puesto y gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima, para tener un surtido adecuado de productos y que los clientes se sientan satisfechos con su servicio.
texts.en:
Maria launched her business in order to earn money for her children's basic needs, since she has to support all four of them. It began about five years ago, when she and a friend decided to set up a taco stand. Maira was later left as the sole owner of the stand, and thanks to her efforts her family has been able to get ahead.

She needs a loan of $575 to buy raw ingredients so that she can offer a wide variety of products in order to leave her customers satisfied. She will repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients to make tacos

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées avec en moyenne vingt huit (28) ans et deux (2) enfants vivant dans des foyers monogames et résident toutes dans le quartier filabougou à Ouéléssébougou (Région de koulikoro 2è région du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parenté et de voisinage.

L’activité dominante du groupe est la vente de fruits et boissons gazeuses non alcoolisées (selon la saison), en plus de cette activité, elles vendent divers articles tel que : le charbon de bois, les vêtements pour nourrissons (chaussures et layettes).

Après plusieurs activités menées à l’individuel sans réussite, elles se sont regroupées pour intégrer le programme de prêt solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt.

Avec ce prêt de 25.000 FCFA par membre, elles comptent acheter 150 kilogrammes de fruits, 60 cannettes de boissons et d’autres divers articles. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place chaque quinze (15) jours auprès des grossistes et vendent en ambulant et au comptant. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice par cycle de 8000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Elles veulent dans les jours à venir, diversifier leur commerce en embrassant la vente des légumes et condiments.
texts.en:
Membership in the Benkadi group is comprised of married women who are on average 28 years old and have two children. They live in monogamous households, all residing in the Filabougou quarter of Ouelessebougou (Koulikoro, Mali). They are known to one another by ties of kinship and proximity. The group’s primary area of endeavor is the sale of fruit and seasonal non-alcoholic carbonated beverages; in addition, they sell a variety of other items, including charcoal and infant clothing (shoes and layettes). After a series of individual setbacks, they formed a group to join the Soro Yiriwaso group loan program and this will be their first loan. With this loan of approximately $55 (25,000 XOF) per member, they intend to buy 150 kilograms of fruit, 60 cans of drinks and various other articles. They do their purchasing from local wholesalers every 15 days and engage in traveling and cash sales. The women in the Benkadi group hope to realize a profit of $17 (8,000 XOF) each every two weeks. They will use these profits to meet the needs of their families. In the days to come they want to diversify their business, branching out into the sale of vegetables and seasonings.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit, beverages and a variety of other items

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra y generar empleos. Desde su temprana edad ha sido muy inquieta y emprendedora por lo que hace 5 años viendo que su mama tenía un terreno vio la oportunidad de poner un negocio para generar un ingreso extra y empleos para la gente de su comunidad, instalo un auto-lavado, con el apoyo de su familia ha ido sacando adelante su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para darle mantenimiento a las herramientas de trabajo y compra otras que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Marisa started her own business in order to earn extra money, as well as generate employment. From a young age, she has always been very eager and enterprising, which is why 5 years ago, knowing that her mother had a plot of land, she saw a chance to set up her own business so that she could generate an income and employment for the people of her community. She set up a car wash, and with her family’s support, she has beed able to help her business move ahead.

She needs a loan of $575.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to give maintenance to her work tools and purchase other equipment that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase work tools

loans.name: Filiberta

texts.es:
Filiberta inicio el negocio para ayudar a su marido con el gasto familiar. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 7años y con los ahorros que tenia, resultante de ventas que hacia por catalogo, decidió poner una mini-tienda en una habitación de su casa y con el apoyo de los micro créditos ha hecho crecer su tienda lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más mercancía en su negocio. Con tu ayuda saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Filiberta started her own business in order to help her husband with the family expenses. She began approximately 7 years ago with the savings that she obtained as a result of her catalog sales. She decided to set up a mini market in her home. With the support of these micro loans, she has been able to make her store grow, which has allowed her to help her children get ahead in life.

She needs a loan of $950.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase more merchandise for her business. With your help, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado estar activa, además de poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos económicos. Empezó su negocio hace 5 años vendiendo gorditas y tacos en el pasillo de su casa y posteriormente ofreciendo comida entre sus vecinos situación que empezó a darle mejores ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $125 que pagara en 1 mes para comprar materia prima a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Dolores started her business because she has always liked being active and also to be able to help her husband with household expenses. She started her business 5 years ago selling gorditas (like tacos with thicker shells) and tacos in the corridor of her home, more recently offering food among her neighbors. This situation started to provide her with better income.

She needs a loan of $125 that she will repay in one month to purchase raw material at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Material

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores inició el negocio ya que necesitaba tener una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 15 años ofreciendo entre sus amistades tortillas que ella hacia a mano y que viendo que el negocio era bueno y prospero solicito un micro crédito y de ahí empezó a prosperar su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y así poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Dolores launched her business because she needed a source of income to support her children. About 15 years ago, she began to offer hand-made tortillas to her friends. After realizing that it would make a good, lucrative business, she asked for a microloan and her business has prospered ever since.

She needs a loan of US $650, which she will use to buy raw ingredients to make tortillas and maintain her business. She will repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel inició el negocio porque requería de ingresos para mantenerse ella y sus padres. Comenzó hace 2 años cuando rento un local, en el cual puso un pequeño estanquillo para vender frituras y refrescos, pero viendo que la gente le solicitaba víveres se decidió a solicitar un micro crédito y con estos hizo crecer y ha mantenido surtida su tienda.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así resurtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Raquel started her business because she needed income to support herself and her parents. She started 2 years ago when she rented a space where she set up a small table to sell fruits and juices, but noticing people requested groceries she requested a micro credit and her business grew. She needs a loan for $475 to pay in 6 months to buy products and increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo para que el dinero rindiera lo suficiente para mantener a la familia. su esposo fue el que inicio el negocio de la fabricación de los tabiques, pero como en ocasiones no tenían para comprar material, el decidió hace 4 años meterse a trabajar de obrero y la señora Bermúdez solicito un micro crédito para continuar con la fabrica logrando levantarla y así hacer de esta actividad una forma de obtener ingresos adicionales.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material y continuar con su labor. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Matilde began her business in an effort to help her husband financially support their family. Her husband had originally launched a business building interior partition walls, but since he did not have the money to buy materials at times, he decided to begin a different job as a worker four years ago. Mrs. Bermudéz requested a micro-loan to keep the family business going, and was able to turn this activity into an additional source of income.

She needs a loan of US $475 to buy materials so that she can continue with her work. With your help, she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia inició el negocio para poder apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba. Comenzó hace cuatro años después que le ayudaba a su hermana a vender haciendo demostraciones, ella le empezó a pasar ropa para que la vendiera, y hasta la fecha ella es la que compra y le surte.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir mercancía de temporada.
texts.en:
Celia started her business in order to help pay for her children's educations, when her husband's salary wasn't enough. She began helping her sister with wardrobe demonstrations about 4 years ago, and from there, her sister began giving her clothing to sell. Since then, she has been the one who sells it and supplies it.

She needs a loan of $575 US ($1 US = 3 soles, approx.) which she will repay in 6 months so she can stock up on merchandise for the season. Celia inició el negocio para poder apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba. Comenzó hace cuatro años después que le ayudaba a su hermana a vender haciendo demostraciones, ella le empezó a pasar ropa para que la vendiera, y hasta la fecha ella es la que compra y le surte.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir mercancía de temporada.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: La Isla Group

texts.es:
Rosario inicia el negocio hace 2 años vendiendo ropa y zapatos por iniciativa propia, fueron a un viaje León-Moroleón-San Juan de los lagos y surtió mercancía para poderla vender y así ayudar con los gastos de la casa, ya que como su esposo nunca ha tenido un trabajo fijo, siempre ha trabajado por su cuenta hay ocasiones en que ella es la que tiene que sacar adelante a su hijo y los gastos de la casa.

Martina inicio el negocio por invitación de una compañera, ya que su esposo los dejo por irse con otra y ya no se hizo responsable de la casa, y ella sola tuvo que ver de que manera poder cuidar a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante. Comenzó su negocio hace 2 años impulsada por una amiga para que vendiera joyería.

Hortensia inició el negocio por problemas de salud que ella tenia, padecía asma bronquial y a raíz de eso se le subía mucho la presión, empezó como cliente a consumir producto naturistas y mejoro mucho su salud, hace poco mas de 1 años se hizo distribuidora independiente para que mas gente pueda aprovechar los beneficios de los productos.

Ellas son el Grupo La Isla y necesitan un préstamo por US $850 que pagaran en 3 meses para poder invertirlo en su negocio comprando mercancía.
texts.en:
Rosario began selling clothing and shoes two years ago on her own initiative. She and her husband took a trip to León-Moroleón-San Juan of Lakes and bought a variety of merchandise to sell to help pay for household expenditures, since Rosario's husband has never had a salaried job and has always worked odd jobs. Sometimes, Rosario is the one who has to work to help her son get ahead and pay for household expenditures.

Martina launched her business at the invitiation of a friend, since her husband left her for another woman and no longer helps support the family. She had to see for herself what the best way to care for her children and help them get ahead would be. She decided to start selling jewelry two years ago with the encouragement of a friend.

Hortensia started her business because of some health problems she was having. She was suffering from broncheal asthma, and her blood pressure went up dramatically as a result. She began taking natural remedies and they greatly improved her health. A little over a year ago, she became an independent distributor of these products so that more people can enjoy the benefits of natural remedies.

The three women make up the La Isla ("The Island") group and are requesting a loan of $850, which they will repay in three months, to buy more merchandise for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for individual businesses

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana es la coordinadora del Grupo “El Castillo”, ella inició el negocio por necesidad ya que era madre soltera y el único sostén de sus 2 hijos por eso decidió trabajar por su cuenta. Comenzó hace un poco más de 5 años ayudándole a un familiar con la venta de comida, y ahora ya tiene su propio negocio.

Blanca inició el negocio por necesidad para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares dado que no era suficiente con lo que el ganaba. Comenzó hace 6 años con la venta de ropa de segunda vendiendo solo a amistades pero con el tiempo ha ido incrementando su cartera de clientes y así sus ventas y pedidos.

Rosa inició el negocio para salir adelante dado que no era suficiente con lo que ganaba su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Comenzó hace 3 años solo vendiendo ropa sobre pedidos y pequeñas demostraciones entre los vecinos y amigas o casa por casa, ahora se estableció en varios mercados incrementando sus ventas.

Ellas necesitan un préstamo por US $1125 que pagaran en 6 meses para comprar materia prima y mercancía y poder así continuar con sus negocios. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrán adelante!!.
texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of the group “El Castillo” (“The Castle”). She started the business because of necessity, given that she was a single mother and the only means of support for her two children. For this reason, she decided to work for herself. She started a little more than five years ago helping an acquaintance with food sales, and she now has her own enterprise.

Blanca started in business to help her husband support their household expenses, since his wages were not enough to cover them. She started six years ago selling second-hand clothing only to acquaintances but, over time, she has increased her customer base and therefore her sales and orders.

Rosa started in business to get ahead, given that her husband’s earnings were not enough to cover their household and child-related expenses. She started three years ago selling clothing on order, giving small demonstrations at the houses of friends and neighbors or door-to-door. Now, she has established herself in several of the markets and has increased her sales.

These women need a loan of $1,125.00 USD, to be repaid over six months, in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise so they can continue with their endeavors. With your help, they will get ahead!!


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Praxadis

texts.es:
Praxadis inicio con este negocio ya que necesitaba dinero para pagar los gastos de la casa y de su familia. Inicio con este negocio desde hace 2 años vendiendo ropa y regalos en mercados rodantes cercanos a su casa y en su domicilio, y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio.

El necesita un préstamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para invertirlo comprando mas mercancía ya que se acerca una buena temporada
texts.en:
Praxadis started in this business because he needed money to pay his family's household expenses. He started the business two years ago selling clothes and gifts in local travelling markets and in hishome, and little by little he has grown his business.

He needs this loan of $950 which he will repay in 6 months to invest it buying more merchandise now that the good season is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Envera

texts.en: Envera M. anović was born in 1965. She is married and has two children. She lives with her family in M. A.ima near Kalesija. This area is well known as a  farming and animal husbandry area. Envera`s husband is employed, but they are also involved in agriculture. They produce feed for cattle and poultry. The cultivation takes them a lot of tiM. because they do everything manually, but they are happy to have their garden and their corn field. Envera has requested a 1200 KM ($900 USD) loan from Women for Women International to buy a cow. The cow will provide them with milk for their children and for selling.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria luisa inicio con este negocio ya que vive en una avenida principal de su colonia y era un buen punto para iniciar un negocio y ella decidió iniciar con la venta de comidas. Ella necesitaba tener un negocio que le dejara buenos ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. comenzó vendiendo en una mesita afuera de su casa aproximadamente hace 15 años y conforme fue creciendo el negocio las ventas se fueron incrementando y así pudo acondicionar el frente de su casa para establecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar algunos utensilios que le hacen falta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa started her business because she lives on a main avenue in her residential area, so it was a good location for her to get into food sales. She needed to have a business that would bring in good profits so that she could help her husband with the household expenses, thus giving her daughter a better quality of life. She started out by selling food on a little table outside her home approximately 15 years ago. As her business grew, her sales increased; hence she was able to fit out the front of her house in order to properly set up her business.

She needs a loan of $475.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase some kitchen utensils that she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia inició el negocio por iniciativa propia, salir adelante en la economía de su hogar y ayuda a esposo con gastos de escuela y manutención ya que el sale de viaje y para no estar esperanzada a que le deposite dinero, busco una actividad que le generara ingresos. Comenzó hace 1 año cuando una hermana la canalizo con una distribuidora de cosméticos y la dio de alta, entonces ella empezó a vender estos productos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un kit de la nueva temporada y poder así ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Katia took the initiative to launch her business so that she could help her husband pay for household expenses and to help improve the family's economic situation. Her husband travels frequently, and Katia wanted to find her own source of income so that she wasn't constantly waiting for him to deposit money. Katia began her business a year ago, when her sister introduced her to a cosmetics distributor who supplied her with merchandise, which she then began to sell.

Katia needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in three months, to buy this season's cosmetics kit and start selling these new products.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy this season's cosmetics

loans.name: Gloria Irma

texts.es:
Gloria inició el negocio por que esta separada de su esposo y no le gusta esperarse a que le den la pensión ya que tiene necesidades con su hijo y necesita atención especial ya que presenta parálisis cerebral. Esto fue lo que la orillo a vender ropa y zapatos con sus familiares y amigos de la colonia desde hace mas de 28 años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar de zapatos de temporada de otoño-invierno.
texts.en:
Gloria launched her business because she is separated from her husband and doesn't like to rely on her pension since she has to provide for her son, who needs special attention because he has cerebral palsy. This is what drove her to begin selling clothing and shoes with her friends and relatives more than 28 years ago.

Gloria needs a loan of US $575 to buy shoes for the fall/winter season. She will repay the loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fall/winter shoes

loans.name: San Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita inició el negocio porque su hijo estaba estudiando la universidad y no tenia para pagar las cuotas escolares además de gastos del hogar, ya que es viuda. Comenzó hace mas de 6 años elaborando y vendiendo tamales y tacos a vapor en su casa a sus vecinos y conocidos, hasta que logro hacerse de clientela.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima ya que tiene un pedido especial y necesita surtir los ingredientes para este.
texts.en:
Juanita started the business because her son was studying in university and she didn't have money to pay tuition as well as the household expenses now that she is a widow. She started more than six years ago making tacos and tamales in her house and selling them to neighbors and acquaintances, until she was able to build a clientele.

She needs a loan of $750 which she will repay in 6 months to buy material now that she has a special order and she needs to get the ingredients for this.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials

loans.name: San Juana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Juany inició el negocio porque lo que gana su esposo no le alcanza ya que trabaja como soldador y tiene ingresos variables, ante la necesidad de pagar recibos de servicios y manutención de sus hijos. Comenzó hace más de 3 años vendiendo productos naturales entre vecinos y familiares, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía en general. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Juany started the business because what her her husband makes wasn't enough, since her husband works as a soldier and has variabl wages, to meet the need to pay their bills and raise their children. She started selling natural groceries to her neighbors and families 3 years ago, which has permitted her to move forward. She needs a $250 loan which she will pay in three months to buy general merchandise. With your support, she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to produce sweets and arepas for her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of materials for a small motorcycle tire shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in cosmetics products for her small business.

loans.name: Roxana Gloria

texts.es: La señora Roxana, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, ambos, se dedican a la fabricación de zapatos de todo tipo, pero más específicamente se dedican a la fabricación de zapatos para niños, que  a su vez venden en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia. En todo el tiempo que la conocemos ha demostrado ser una perona muy trabajadora, que además se ocupa de sus dos niños que aún están en edad escolar. se trata de una cliente con un ecxelente Historial Crediticio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roxana works with her husband and together they manufacture shoes of all sorts, but mainly they produce shoes for kids, which they sell to one of the most popular markets in La Paz, Bolivia. As long as we know her, she has demonstrated to be a hard worker, she also takes care of her two children who are in school. She is a client with great credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Sante Se Riches Group

texts.en:
"Sante Se Riches" is a group of 15 members coming from one of the poorest countries in the world - Haiti. Every member in this group is desperate to change their lives, and have come into this with absolutely nothing. 

Pauline F. is the group representative, and wants to start her very own business selling fish. Pauline is a very determined mother of three young children, and wants to change the lives of those children, and also the lives of her future grandchildren. Her only dream is to improve the life of her children. She believes that starting this business is the first step to reaching that goal. 

On behalf of Pauline, the group, and Esperanza International---- We thank you for your support!!

loans.use: Fish Vendor

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D., 39 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Kounkané Viviane Wade depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des graines d’arachide pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide et vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Maimouna D., age 39, is married and has five children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Kounkané Viviane Wade for six years. She wants to buy peanuts to make into peanut butter to sell. Her income enables her to help with family expenses. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanut butter

loans.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafía llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 años, él se dedica a hacer todo tipo de articulos de publicidad en serigragia como lo son:  tazas, llaveros, impresión de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos.  El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos están estudiando.  Su esposa ademas de las labores de cuidado y atencion de su casa, le ayuda en la atención y administracion del negocio.  El préstamo él lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales para impresiones, ya que en esta época hay muchos pedidos.

Su deseo es hacer cada día más grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la protección económica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su empresa de serigrafia, como telas y otra materia prima,

loans.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafía llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 años, él se dedica a hacer todo tipo de articulos de publicidad en serigragia como lo son:  tazas, llaveros, impresión de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos.  El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos están estudiando.  Su esposa ademas de las labores de cuidado y atencion de su casa, le ayuda en la atención y administracion del negocio.  El préstamo él lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales para impresiones, ya que en esta época hay muchos pedidos.
Su deseo es hacer cada día más grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la protección económica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su empresa de serigrafia, como telas y otra materia prima,

loans.name: Miguel Aparicio

texts.es:
Miguel tiene una empresa de serigrafía llamada Maranatha desde hace 9 años, él se dedica a hacer todo tipo de articulos de publicidad en serigrafia como lo son:  tazas, llaveros, impresión de lapiceros, camisas y uniformes escolares, deportivos.  El es casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos están estudiando.  Su esposa ademas de las labores de cuidado y atencion de su casa, le ayuda en la atención y administracion del negocio.  El préstamo él lo necesita para comprar materia prima como lo es telas y otros materiales para impresiones, ya que en esta época hay muchos pedidos.
Su deseo es hacer cada día más grande su empresa, y brindarle a toda su familia la protección económica y apoyo que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Miguel has a printing business called Maranatha for the last 9 years, he creates all type of advertising articles like: cups, key-rings, pens, t-shirts, school and sport uniforms. He is married, has 3 children, two of them are in school. His wife besides taking care of the children and their house, helps him attending and managing the business. He needs the loan to buy material like cloths and printing materials, because there is high demand this season. His wish is to grow his business and provide his family all the economic support they need.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for his printing business like cloths and printing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama D. is 45 year old. She is divorced and the mother of six children. She is a local manufacturer of soaps. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She also sells palm oil for cooking. She is not able to produce soap in large quantities because of the lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to improve her income so she can support her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called St. John Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Vinicio Policarpio

texts.es: Vinicio en la actualidad es encargado de producción de una empresa de serigrafía, desde hace mas de 2 años él se dedica a la fabricacion de toda clase de playeras y trabajos de impresión en serigrafia.  Con la experiencia y conocimiento que él tiene, ahora él quiere poner su propio negocio de serigrafía y por eso necesita el préstamo.  El esta dispuesto a trabajar duro y seguir luchando por la vida.  Su sueño es seguir estudiando en la universidad y llegar a convertirse en un profesional de éxito.  En la actualidad él esta soltero, pero es una persona muy formal y responsable.
texts.en:
Vinicio is currently in charge of production at a printing company, for the last 2 years he had worked creating t-shirts other printing materials. With his experience and knowledge he wants to set up his own printing business so he needs a loan. He is willing to work hard to progress. His dream is to go to College and turn into a successful professional. He is currently single but is a very formal and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a printing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of meat and fruits for her small business.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail K., 38, is married and has two children. She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She makes her sales by 'hawking,' which is door-to-door sales.
