From age nine to eighteen, she sold groceries in the markets of Tupala, Huacullani, Huaitiri, and others. At age nineteen she married her husband and they installed their grocery shops. With a capital accumulated, she presently sells fuel, alpaca, llama, and sheep meat, mostly to the wholesalers of Tacna. With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she proposes to buy one cylinder of fuel with 600 Soles and with the rest of the capital she will buy alpacas for the sale of meat. Each alpaca costs 180 to 200 Soles. Her goal is to have a very beautiful home in Mazocruz, set up a commercial shop, hire employees to attend to the public, and she will just administer it. Her goal is also that her kids study and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fuel and alpacas for the cost of meat.

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Panamericana podemos encontrar a la asociación “San Pablo”  a la fecha cuenta con nueve miembros activos que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace más de siete años. 
Diversos son los negocios de esta asociación  por ejemplo algunas de ellas tienen una mini- distribuidora de perfumes de marca( Reblon), Sonia es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, Luz al igual que otras de sus compañeras se dedican a la venta de electrodomésticos que por lo general los dejan a crédito a instituciones   y personas particulares. La mayoría de ellas son casadas y con hijos siendo Lidia y Verónica las únicas solteras del grupo, pero de la misma forma que sus compañeras trabajan para mantener económicamente a sus familias.
Todas ellas quieren ampliar sus ventas por lo que necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
In the Panamerican focal center we find the "San Pablo" association, which to date has nine active members who work together with Kiva partner Pro-Mujer for more than seven years. The members' businesses are diverse, for example, some of the women run a small brand-name (Reblon) perfume distribution; Sonia is owner of a convenience store, and Luz is as well; other members sell electric appliances on credit to institutions and certain people. The majority of the members are married with children — Lidia and Verónica are the only single members in the group — and all are untied by the goal to work for their families' economic stabilities. All of the women want to increase their sales, which in turn means they need to buy a larger quantity of supplies, so they can generate more earnings to allow them to improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products to increase their sales

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Herminia Espínola de Aguero, es casada, el cónyuge tomo la decisión de viajar al exterior (España) por razones económicas, y gracias a esto la Sra. cuenta con otro ingreso pues el envía dinero mensualmente desde el exterior.

Los mismos tienen dos hijos, quienes son menores de edad. Herminia posee un copetín, la misma esta muy bien ubicada en una zona altamente comercial. Se inició con un capital de apenas Gs. 500.000. (alrededor de 110 dólares), que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes.

La señora retira el préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de comestibles, como: empanadas, chipa guazu, milanesas, otros.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia E. de Augero is married. Her husband took the decision to travel abroad (Spain) due to financial reasons, and thanks to this, Mrs. Herminia has an extra income since he sends money on a monthly basis from abroad.

They have two children, who are both minors. Herminia owns a drink stand. It is well located in a busy commercial zone. She started with a budget of just $110 USD and has been expanding as the years pass by. Today she has ample amounts of customers.

Mrs. Herminia would like this loan to purchase materials necessary to make edible items such as empanadas, chipa guazu, milanesas, and others.

One of her aspirations is to equip her business with furniture to create a more comfortable environment that is inviting to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase edible products such as meat, flour, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana A., es soltera, tiene 52 años, no tiene pareja actualmente, su única hija tiene 23 años, quien también trabaja con ella, en la confección de todo tipo de bolsos y maletines, actividad a la que se dedica hace ya más de 20 años, conjuntamente con su padre quien también es su socio comercial.

El negocio lo tienen en su propio domicilio. Ella aprendió este oficio de su padre, y está muy orgullosa del mismo, ya que en cada uno de sus diseños resalta principalmente la calidad de la confección, que según como manifiestan posee una muy buena durabilidad, y diseños exclusivos para cada cliente de acuerdo a los gustos en cuanto a los colores y formas para su mejor aprovechamiento de espacios.

La señora Juana A. retira el préstamo para la adquisición de más telas y así poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, mediante la adquisición de más máquinas de coser industriales y así brindar puestos de trabajo en tan noble actividad, para el desarrollo profesional y económico de los jóvenes principalmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana A. is a 52-year-old single mother of a 23-year-old daughter, who also works with her making all types of handbags and satchels. She has been in this business for over 20 years, alongside her father, who is also her business partner.

The business is located in their own home. She learned this skill from her father, and she is very proud of him because quality stands out in each of his designs. The products have great durability, and they are designed exclusively for each customer according to their taste in color and form, making the most use of space.

Ms. Juana A. is requesting this loan in order to purchase more fabric, thus allowing her to be able to fill all her customers’ orders.

One of her aspirations is to be able to expand the business soon by means of obtaining more industrial sewing machines, and in so doing offer job positions in this noble field, mainly for the professional and financial development of young people.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making handbags and satchels

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 20 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es conveniente y progenitora de un hijo varón de 01 año con 07 meses de edad. Vive en el Centro Poblado de Imicate, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Fe y Alegría” en Yunguyo. Con este crédito de S/.500 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará papa, chuño, tarwi, haba para ser comercializados en la ciudad de Tacna. 

Yesenia a los 13 años de edad empezó con el negocio de productos ya mencionados, desde que cumplió los 16 años de edad convive con su esposo y continúa con su negocio. 

Su meta es terminar con la construcción de su casa en el sector de Challapampa, el cual está cerca a la carretera de Yunguyo, instalar una tienda de abarrotes y educar a su hijo para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 20 years old and completed primary school. She is married and mother of a son who is one year and seven months old. She lives in Centro Poblado of Imicate, district and province of Yunguyo, Puno. She is a member of the community bank "Fe y Alegría" (Faith and Happiness) in Yunguyo. With this loan for 500 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy potatos, potato starch, tarwi (edible Andean bean), and broad bean for reselling in the city of Tacna. At age 13, Yesenia began this business with the mentioned products, and when she was 16, she married her husband and continued this business. Her goal is to finish the construction of her home in the sector of Challapampa, which is near the highway in Yunguyo, set up a grocery store, and educate her son to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: potato, potato starch, tarwi, broad beans, etc.

loans.name: Yudith Roxana

texts.es:
Yudith tiene 23 años de edad, estudió cuarto de secundaria, es conviviente y madre de un niño de 04 años de edad. Vive en el Jr. Ejército s/n (frente al mercado), distrito de Mazocruz, provincia El Collao, Puno.

Desde el año 2005 integra el Banco Comunal “Generación 2000” en Mazocruz. Por motivos familiares tuvo que dejar el Banco Comunal, reingresando nuevamente hace dos ciclos. Con el crédito que le otorgaron de S/.500 Nuevos Soles pudo comprar 03 cabezas de alpaca. 

Yudith empezó a dedicarse al negocio desde que tuvo su pareja, a los 22 años de edad, con la venta de carne y fibra de alpaca, llama y también carne y lana de ovino que entrega a los mayoristas de la ciudad de Tacna. De vez en cuando prepara comida para vender en la feria sabatina de Mazocruz.

Con este crédito de S/.800 Nuevos Soles, el cual será cancelado en 04 cuotas, comprará 05 cabezas de alpaca que será entregado en carne a los mayoristas.

Su meta es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave, apoyar a su hijo hasta que sea profesional. También piensa llevar productos de abarrotes a las diferentes ferias para generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Yudith is 23 years old and completed a fourth of primary school. She is married and mother of a four year old son. She lives in Jr. Ejército (in front of the market), district of Mazocurz, province of El Collao, Puno. In 2005, she joined the community bank "Generación 2000" in Mazocruz. For family reasons, she had to leave the community bank, and rejoin after two cycles. With the credit of 500 Soles that they granted her, she was able to buy three heads of alpaca. Yudith began to dedicate herself to this business since she has been with her husband, at the age of 22, with the sale of meat and fiber from alpacas and llamas, and also meat and wool from sheep, which she sells to the wholesalers of the city of Tacna. Sometimes she prepares food to sell at the Saturday market in Mazocruz. With this loan of 800 Soles, which she will repay in four months, she will buy five heads of alpaca that she will sell as meat to wholesalers. Her goal is to buy a home in the city of Ilave and support her son until he becomes a professional. She also plans to deliver grocery products to the various markets to generate more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: five head of alpaca

loans.name: Pequeño Milagro (Small Miracle) Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra actualmente en su segundo ciclo cuenta con 17 integrantes.

Las integrantes se dedican a actividades varias las cuales se detallan a continuación:

-Lida C., cantina

-Francisca C., Vta de mercaderias varias

-Letizia T., Venta de ropas

-Nilda A., Venta de comestibles

-Mirian N., Venta de ropas

-Marina C., Venta de ropas usadas

-Liliana N., Venta de lenceria

-Lourdes C., Venta de bebidas y ropas

-Maria Dolores E., Venta de comestibles

-Blanca B., Venta de lenceria

-Paola O., Venta de comestibles

-Ramona S., Kiosko

-Maria Victoria E., Peluqueria

-Sonia V., Venta de minutas

-Angela G., Vta de comestibles

-Maria C., Vta de frutas

-Marcelina R., Vta de comestibles.

La Directora de este comité es la Sra. Lida Chávez quien es vendedora de golosinas desde hace 5 años, ella empezó vendiendo algunas golosinas frente a una escuela de la zona, y actualmente tiene su propio negocio dentro del predio de la institución es la cantinera. El comité presenta buena relación interna y respeto entre sus integrantes.

Cabe destacar también la puntualidad en los pagos y asistencia de la mayoría de las integrantes a las reuniones.
texts.en:
This committee has 17 members and is currently in its second cycle.

The members work in various activities, as listed below:

-Lidia C., Cantina

-Francisca C., Sale of various merchandise

-Letizia T., Clothing sales

-Nilda A., Food sales

-Mirian N., Clothing sales

-Marina C., Used clothing sales

-Liliana N., Lingerie sales

-Lourdes C., Beverage and clothing sales

-Maria Dolores E., Food sales

-Blanca B., Lingerie sales

-Paola O., Food sales

-Ramona S., Kiosk

-Maria Victoria E., Hairdressing

-Sonia V., Food sales

-Angela G., Food sales

-Maria C., Fruit sales

-Marcelina R., Food sales

The director of this group is Mrs. Lidia C., who has sold sweets for the last 5 years. She began selling sweets in front of a school zone and nowadays has her own business within the institution's land, where she serves beverages. The committee has good internal relations and respect among its members.

It is also worth emphasizing the punctuality of their payments and the attendance of the majority of the members at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, sodas, beer, wine, liquor, etc., to buy vegetables, to buy sugar, herbs, flour, oil, bread, dairy products, meat, noodles, rice, starch, etc.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracia a la Señora: Lucia Báez de Oviedo, quien se enteró acerca del programa y de la fundación gracias a las integrantes del comité “Mujeres en Acción”, del mismo Barrio Pto. Pabla de la ciudad de Lambaré.

Podemos hablar de alguna de las integrantes en este caso de: La Sra. Basilia L. de M., quien es viuda desde hace 5 años, tiene 4 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad, casados con hijos.

Basilia es una señora muy colaboradora con la comunidad, pertenece al grupo de oración legión de María de la Capilla Niño Salvador del Mundo del Barrio Puerto Pabla de la ciudad de Lambaré. Además visita a los enfermos del Barrio llevándoles una palabra de aliento, y la comunión.

Ella aprendió en un curso a realizar bordados con Hilos, tipo Crochet, como: ropas para Bebés, medias, guantes, zapatitos, gorras, para recién nacidos, además de prendas para damas como Blusas, polleras, vestidos, camisillas, etc.

Las actividades de las otras integrantes se detallan a continuación:

Lucia Báez de Oviedo ( Confección y Vta de Banderas).

Sonia Liz M. Díaz (Conf y Vta de Ropas)

Basilia L. de M. (Bordados de Crochet y Ao Po´i )

Idalina C. (Bordados de Chochet )

Luisa M. de Cardozo (Vta de Comidas)

Gregoria S. de Cañiza (Vta de Cosméticos)

Clotilde E. de Ibarra (Despensa)

Bertilda B. V. (Vta de Empanadas)

Aurelia V. Díaz ( Vta de Frutas y Verduras)

Fortunata González (Despensa)

Maura C. Coronel (Conf y Vta de Ropas)

Cirila V. de B. (Vta de Prod de Limpieza

) Vilma C. de Báez (Conf y Vta de Ao Poi)

Rosa E. Barrientos (Chrochet)

Gabriela C. (Vta de conf y Vta de Ropas)

Teodora R. de Ferreira (Vta de Frutas y Verduras)

María Damiana M. ( Vta Comidas)

Myrian Felipa P. de Delgado (Vtas de Helados)
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Mrs. Lucia B. de Oviedo, who learned about the program and the foundation thanks to the members of the "Mujeres en Accion" (Women in Action) group, from the same neighborhood, Puerto Pabla, in the city of Lambare.

We can talk about some of the members, in this case of: Mrs. Basilia L. de M., who was widowed 5 years ago and has 4 children, all of whom are already grown and married with children.

Basilia is a woman very involved in the community. She belongs to the prayer legion group María de la Capilla Niño Salvador del Mundo of the Puerto Pabla neighborhood in the city of Lambare. Additionally, she visits the ill in the neighborhood, bringing them words of hope and communion.

She learned in a course how to embroider with thread, crochet style, things such as: baby clothing, stockings, gloves, little shoes, hats for newborns, in addition to women's clothing such as blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, etc.

The activities of the other members are listed below:

Lucia Báez de Oviedo (Production and Sale of Flags)

Sonia Liz M. Díaz (Production and Sale of Clothing)

Basilia L. de M. (Crochet and Ao Poi (traditional Paraguayan weaving))

Idalina C. (Crochet )

Luisa M. de Cardozo (Food Sales)

Gregoria S. de Cañiza (Cosmetics Sales)

Clotilde E. de Ibarra (General Store)

Bertilda B. V. (Sale of Empanadas)

Aurelia V. Díaz (Fruit and Vegetable Sales)

Fortunata González (General Store)

Maura C. Coronel (Production and Sale of Clothing)

Cirila V. de B. (Sale of Cleaning Products)

Vilma C. de Báez (Production and Sale of Ao Poi (traditional Paraguayan weaving))

Rosa E. Barrientos (Crochet)

Gabriela C. (Production and Sale of Clothing)

Teodora R. de Ferreira (Fruit and Vegetable Sales)

María Damiana M. (Food Sales)

Myrian Felipa P. de Delgado (Ice Cream Sales)


Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, cotton thread, food products such as sugar, oil, salt, meat, dairy products, canned goods, sodas, candy; to also buy cosmetics, clothing, and footware

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen E., es soltera, la misma tiene una pareja con la cual vive desde hace 15 años, y tienen dos hijos, quienes son menores de edad y uno de ellos ya acude a una escuela privada. El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, zona altamente comercial, sobre la Avda. Dr. Paiva, inició con un capital de Gs. 500.000.- U$ 120.- aproximadamente, que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes.

La señora retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de mercería como remeras, blusas, lencería variada, algunas de ellas son semi nuevas.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. María del Carmen E. has been living with her domestic partner for 15 years. They have two underage children together, one of whom already attends private school. Her business is well-situated in a highly commercial zone on Dr. Paiva Avenue. She started out with a capital of 500,000 PYG (approximately $120.00 USD), which grew as the time passed. She currently has a large client-base.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise such as t-shirts, blouses, and assorted undergarments, some of which are semi-new.

One of her aspirations is to be able to expand her business with equipment and furniture soon in order to offer her customers a more comfortable and enjoyable setting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase t-shirts, blouses, undergarments, and children’s apparel

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Villa tejada  esta ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Las Palmeras”  que trabajan con mucha responsabilidad en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito y actividades internas.
Cuentan que carecen de servicios básicos ya que viven en alquiler en pequeños ambientes que no cuentan con agua potable, tampoco con gas domiciliario, por lo que deben abastecerse de piletas públicas y garrafas de distribución.
La actividad principal de este grupo es la confección de ropa que luego las venden en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Quieren ampliar su producción y vender en otras feria de la ciudad, por lo que necesitan comprar  materia prima en mayor cantidad, con esto obtener mayores ganancias que les permita ahorrar para poder alquilar ambientes cómodos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of "The Palm Trees" work in the focal center of the city of El Alto with a lot of responsibility to fulfill their financial obligations and business activities. They are without basic services at home because they live in small rental units with no running water or gas, so they stock up at public fountains and fuel distribution centers. The main activity of this group is making clothes, which they then sell at the July 16th Market in El Alto. They want to increase their production and sell at other markets in the city, so they need larger quantities of raw matterials (thread, cloth, etc.). With this, they can generate more earnings, allowing them to save so they can rent more comfortable dwellings for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (thread, cloth, etc.) to increase their production

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria Elva es una persona, joven que esta trabajando en el mercado general de abastos junto con su madre.

Para poder solventar sus estudios y las de sus hermanos, ella viene de madrugada, desde la cuidad de Capiata como 18 km. de la capital, para poder terminar como a las 8 de la tarde y tener tiempo, para ir a estudiar y luego irse hasta el colegio.

Además comenta que le gusta su trabajo y tener independencia económica

.
texts.en:
Maria Elva is a young person who is working in the general basic products market with her mother.

To be able to cover her studies and those of her brothers, she arrives at daybreak from the city of Capiata, some 18 km. from the capital, to be able to finish at around 8 in the afternoon and have time to go to study and then get to school.

Additionally, she mentions that she likes her work and having economic independence.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, vegetables in bulk, tomatoes, carrots, onions, eggplant, etc.

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es:
La señora Nilsa Ramona es una persona sacrificada y muy trabajadora, viene de una cuidad llamada Caaguazu que queda como a 250 km de la capital. Ella prácticamente ella vive en su lugar de trabajo con sus 2 hijos pequeños desde hace 3 años, el salón donde tiene sus mercaderías es bastante amplio lo divide y ahi tiene, sus comodidades familiares que le facilita quedarse a dormir entre semana ahí y los fines de semana ir a su casa en su ciudad.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras en general en el mercado general de abastos y dice que a pesar de su trabajo tan sacrificado, ella desea seguir luchando para que sus hijos puedan estudiar y acceder a mejores posibilidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nilsa Ramona is a selfless and hard-working person. She is from a city called Caaguazu, about 250 kilometers outside of the capital. Nilsa has practically lived in her store for the past three years, with her two children. She divided the large room into a section for merchandise and a section where her family can sleep during the week. On the weekends, they go to her house in her hometown. Nilsa sells vegetables in the general supplies market. She says that in spite of her selfless work she wants to keep fighting so that her children can go to school and have better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise: tomatoes, peppers, carrots, onions and others

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
La señora Reina Meliana B., es soltera, tiene una hija, quien es menor de edad y acude a una escuela pública. El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, en el centro del mercado Nº 4, zona altamente comercial, sobre la Avda. Rodríguez de Francia c/Battilana, inició con un capital de Gs. 1.000.000.- U$ 250.- aproximadamente, que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes y la zona en la que se encuentra es muy poblada y muy concurrida.

La señora retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de mercería como remeras, blusas, lencería variada y ropa interior tambien para caballeros, especialmente prendas para niños para la temporada primavera - verano. A muy tempranas horas del dia inicia sus actividades aproximadamente a las 04:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para su propio futuro salón comercial y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reina Meliana B. is single and has one daughter. Her daughter is young, and goes to public school. Reina’s business has a great location in the center of Market number 4, in the business district, on Rodríguez de Francia Avenue c/Battilana. Reina starts her day at a very early hour – 4:00 AM – in order to buy everything that she needs for her business. She started with approximately Gs. 1,000,000, equivalent to US$250, which has grown with as time passed. Now she has a large portfolio of clients, and her shop is located in a well-populated, busy area. Reina would like a loan to buy various merchandise, such as T-shirts, blouses, a variety of lingerie and underwear for men and women, and especially children’s clothes for spring and summer. One of Reina’s goals is to be able to expand her business soon, by buying equipment or furnishings for her future store, in order to offer a more comfortable environment to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, such as T-shirts, blouses, lingerie in general and children's clothes.

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracia a la Señora: Rosa Isabel López de Mazacote, quien se enteraron acerca del Programa y de la fundación gracias a las integrantes del otros comités, quienes son amigas de la mencionada señoras quienes también viven de la ciudad de Lambaré.

Podemos hablar de alguna de las integrantes en este caso de: La Sra. María Irene M. Caballero, es soltera., pero vive en pareja con Cipriano Ramón Gamarra, quien es constructor. Ella es cocinera, elabora comestibles como: Empanadas de carne, de pollo, de jamón y queso, y de mandioca, sándwiches de Milanesa, de jamón y queso, de verduras, tortillas, etc.

Ella se levanta todas las mañanas para preparar su productos y los exhibe en un pequeño puestito en su propia casa, sobre una mesa.

Las actividades de las otras integrantes son: 1.- Rosa López ( Vta de Frutas y Verduras). 2.- María M. (Vta de Helados) 3.- Elida V. (Mercería ) 4.- María M. (Vta de Comestibles ) 5.- Luciana Gómez (Vta de Pescado) 6.- María del Carmen Pérez (Vta de Comestibles ) 7.- Isabel López (Vta de Lencería) 8.- Marta O. (Vta de Lencería) 9.- María V. (Mercerías) 10.- Fermina A. (Vta de Asaditos) 11.- Yolanda A. ( Conf y Vta de Ropas) 12.- Miryan A. (vendedora ambulante) 13.-Liz O. (Vta de Frutas y Verduras ) 14.- Ancia Cáceres (Mercería ) 15.-Teresa T. (Mercería) 16.-Blanca B. (Vta de Comidas) 17.- Dora V. (Vta de Toallas)
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to Mrs. Rosa Isabel López de Mazacote, who became involved with the Program and the foundation thanks to friends who are members of other committees and also live in the city of Lambaré. This committee includes: Mrs. María Irene M. Caballero lives with her boyfriend, Cipriano Ramón Gamarra, a construction worker. María is a chef, who cooks meals such as: meat, chicken, ham, and cheese empanadas; tapioca; chicken, ham and cheese, and vegetable sandwiches; tortillas; etc. María wakes up early each morning to prepare her products, and she exhibits them on a table in a small space in her own home. The other members have other types of businesses: 1.- Rosa López ( fruit and vegetable sales). 2.- María M. (ice cream sales) 3.- Elida V. (hardware store ) 4.- María M. (food sales ) 5.- Luciana Gómez (fish sales) 6.- María del Carmen Pérez (food sales) 7.- Isabel López (Lingerie sales) 8.- Marta O. (Lingerie sales) 9.- María V. (hardware stores) 10.- Fermina A. (barbecue sales) 11.- Yolanda A. (sewing and clothing sales) 12.- Miryan A. (traveling sales) 13.-Liz O. (fruit and vegetable sales) 14.- Ancia Cáceres (hardware) 15.-Teresa T. (hardware) 16.-Blanca B. (food sales) 17.- Dora V. (towel sales)

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy foodstuffs like sugar, meats, milk, bread, oil, among others. Also ice cream, fruits, vegetables, fish, clothing, household goods, etc.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Santiago A. es mozo de profesión, luego había puesto un restaurante, siempre en lugares bien ubicado para eso, pero pagando arrendamientos, por lo que la ganancia no era tan buena.

Hace 10 años aproximadamente, se animo y abrió su despensa con mercerías y comidas por supuesto en su domicilio lo cual le resultó, ya que hoy esta floreciente su negocio y siempre atendido por el mismo.

El comercializa todo tipo de comestibles de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, harina, carnes, etc. además de comidas y algunos artículos de mercería.
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago A. is a waiter by profession, and he previously started a restaurant. It is located in a good area, but rent payments prevented him from earning enough. About ten years ago, Santiago decided to open a grocery store in his home, selling hardware and food. His store is now flourishing, and he always tends it himself. Santiago sells all types of food and basic goods such as sugar, oil, flour, meats, etc. as well as food and some hardware.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, drinks, milk products, and basic products, hardware products, and general merchandise

loans.name: Fanáticas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Los Andes esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a éste  pertenece la asociación “fanáticas ” que trabaja junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace  un año aproximadamente , demostrando gratitud y lealtad a dicha institución.
Existen diversas actividades dentro la asociación, por ejemplo se dedican a la confección y venta de zapatos y al tejido de mantas de vicuña, productos que los comercializan en principales mercados de la ciudad.
 Para ampliar su producción necesitan comprar materia prima, es decir cuero de vaca y/o cuerina, y fibra de vicuña, para el tejido de las mantas y mantillas, tienen el sueño de formar una empresa grande, que genere mayores ingresos para sus familias y además pueda dar oportunidad de trabajo a otros.
texts.en:
The town center Los Andes is located in the city of El Alto, where exists the association "Fanáticas," which has worked together with the group Pro-Mujer for approximately one year, showing gratitude and loyalty to the group. Various activities exist within the association. For example, some are dedicated to the construction and sales of shoes, and some are dedicated to the weaving of vicuna (a llama-like animal of the central Andes that yields a soft wool) blankets, which they sell in the city markets. To increase their production, they need to buy more raw materials, such as cow leather and vicuna wool for weaving blankets. Their dream is to form a large business that will generate greater incomes for their families and provide work opportunities to others.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather and vicuna wool

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a las Señoras: Antonia T. y Silvia Lorena A., quienes se enteraron acerca del Programa y de la fundación gracias a las integrantes del comité “Mujeres Victoriosas”, del mismo Barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de Lambaré.

Podemos hablar de alguna de las integrantes en este caso de: La Sra. Mara Luz Cáceres, tiene 3 hijos, vive en pareja. Hace varios años atrás fue a la ciudad de Buenos Aires, Argentina donde vivió toda su juventud, allí empezó a trabajar en una fábrica donde preparaban papas fritas, las envasaban y las repartían en los supermercados a pedidos.

En esa fábrica conoció a un compatriota paraguayo, se hicieron amigos, luego novios., y entonces decidieron volver a Paraguay. Consiguieron un terreno en el Asentamiento Villa Zulma del Barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de Lambaré.

Ellos trajeron esa idea, de producir papas fritas, y se dispusieron en hacerlo en su propia casa y así fue que empezaron a probar si tenían éxito, les fue bien.

Fue así que la Sra. Mara Luz, integró así el comité de mujeres con la esperanza de incrementar las ventas. Hoy día realizan los productos a pedidos de Despensa y Supermercados.

Las demás integrantes desarrollan las siguientes actividades: 1.- Silvia A. ( Vta de Remedios). 2.- Arminda Arevalos (Vta de Vta de Comidas) 3.- Mara Luz Cáceres (Vta de Papas Fritas) 4.- Cyntia A. (Vta de Comestibles ) 5.- Gladys T. Vda de Baez (Mercería) 6.- Antonia T. (Vta de Empanadas ) 7.- Mirna R. (Vta de Platería) 8.- Isabel González (Vta de Lencería) 9.- Ramona R. (Vta de Ropas) 10.- Floretina B. (Vta de Lencería y Sábanas) 11.- Raimunda C. (Vta de Ropas) 12.- Laura A. (Vta de Colchas) 13.- María O. (Mini-cargas ) 14.-Angelica Agüero (Mercería) 15.-Sabina S. (Vta de conf y Vta de Ropas)
texts.en:
This committee formed thanks to Mrs. Antonia T. and Mrs. Silvia Lorena A., who got involved in the program and the foundation thanks to members of the “Victorious Women” committee from the same neighborhood in the city of Lambaré. One of the members of this committee is Mrs. Mara Luz Cáceres. She has three children and lives with her partner. Many years ago she went to Buenos Aires, Argentina, where she spent all of her childhood. There she began to work in a factory, where she prepared french fries, which were packed and sold in supermarkets. Mara met another Paraguayan in this factory and they first became friends, then partners. They decided to return together to Paraguay. They bought some land in the Villa Zulma settlement in the San Antonio neighborhood in the city of Lambaré. The pair continued to make french fries, and they tested the market by distributing the fries from their home. This was successful. It was then that Mrs. Mara Luz became a member of the Women with Hope committee in order to increase her sales. Today she fills orders for food stores and supermarkets. The other members work in the following sectors: 1.- Silvia A. ( remedy sales). 2.- Arminda Arevalos (food sales) 3.- Mara Luz Cáceres (french fry sales) 4.- Cyntia A. (food sales ) 5.- Gladys T. Vda de Baez (hardware) 6.- Antonia T. (empanada sales) 7.- Mirna R. (silversmith) 8.- Isabel González (lingerie sales) 9.- Ramona R. (clothing sales) 10.- Floretina B. (lingerie and sheet sales) 11.- Raimunda C. (clothing sales) 12.- Laura A. (bedspread sales) 13.- María O. (small loads) 14.-Angelica Agüero (hardware) 15.-Sabina S. (clothing and candy sales)

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food, natural remedies, clothing, sheets and blankets, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señorita Sonia Dávalos, es soltera. El negocio lo tiene muy bien ubicado, en el centro del mercado Nº 4, zona altamente comercial, sobre la Avda. Rodríguez de Francia c/Battilana, inició con un capital de Gs. 1.000.000.- U$ 250.- aproximadamente, que fue ampliando con el correr de los años, pues actualmente cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes y la zona en la que se encuentra es muy poblada y muy concurrida.

La señorita Sonia retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de zapatería como ser: championes, sandalias,calzados para damas y caballeros, especialmente para la temporada primavera - verano. A muy tempranas horas del dia inicia sus actividades aproximadamente a las 06:00 Hs A.M. A fin de comprar todo lo que necesita para su negocio.

Una de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente este negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario para su propio futuro salón comercial y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sonia D. is single. Her business is very well located in the center of the No. 4 market a highly commercial zone above the Rodríguez de Francia c/Battilana avenue. She started her business with approximately $250 in capital. Throughout the years, her business has been expanding as she relies on an expansive list of clients and she is located in a highly populated and busy zone.

Sonia requires this loan to purchase various articles for her shoe shop such as: slippers, sandals, shoes for men and women and especially shoes for the spring-summer seasons. Sonia starts her day very early at 6:00 am so that she can purchase everything she needs for her business.

One of her goals is to be able to expand her business and acquire equipment and furniture to be able to set up her own commercial space so that she can offer a more comfortable and pleasant environment for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sandals, tennis shoes and men and women's shoes.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es una persona sacrificada y muy trabajadora, soltera tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y cosméticos de forma ambulante y bajo pedido. Su venta mas fuerte lo hace dentro del mercado general de abastos y zonas cercanas de su vivienda.

Los primeros días de la semana levanta pedidos y a partir del miércoles hace la entrega y cobranzas de su mercaderías, tiene clientelas formadas, con este trabajo lo cría a sus pequeños y lo hace estudiar.
texts.en:
Sonia is a self sacrificing and hardworking woman. She is single and has two young children. She dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and costmetics as a traveling salesperson and by order. She gets the most sales at the general market and in areas close to her home.

During the first days of the week she takes orders and starting on Wednesdays she delivers and collects payments for her merchandise. She has established clients and with this work she is able to raise her children and provide an education for them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like clothing, general merchandise and cosmetics.

loans.name: Florecer Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Los Andes  a éste pertenece, la asociación “Florecer”, integrada por 12 miembros ansiosos de progresar en sus pequeños negocios.
La mayoría en el grupo estan casados y afirman que necesitan ayudar a sus parejas en la economía del hogar, ya que tienen un promedio de 4 niños , tal es el caso de Lupe, que lamentablemente se separo de su pareja y tubo que hacerse cargo de su familia ella sola por lo que necesita mayores recursos para sustentar los gastos diarios de su familia.
La actividad principal en la asociación es el comercio, venden chompas tejidas en lana, comida, jugos de fruta natural, cosméticos y otros dependiendo de la temporada. Productos que los ofrecen en la feria del mercado Tiahuanacu de la ciudad de El Alto. Ellas precisan capital para incrementar su mercadería  de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
In El Alto city in the center of the Andes mountains, is the association “Florecer” (to blossom), which has 12 members anxious to success in their small businesses. Most of the group members are married and indicate that they need to help their husbands with the household expenses. The average number of children per member is 4. Such is the case of Lupe, who sadly separated from her husband and had to take charge of her family alone so she needs more resources to support her family’s daily needs. The primary activity in the association is sales. They sell knitted wool sweaters, food, natural fruit juices, cosmetics, and other season items. They offer their products in the Tiahuanacu market in El Alto city. They need capital to increase their merchandise and in this way generate greater earning for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Miriam Del Rosario

texts.es: Inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo golosinas y refrescos naturales en el corredor de su casa hace cinco años y aprovechando la oportunidad de tener un primer  crédito con ADIM de $100.00 compró más golosinas y ofreció comidas rápidas, desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. Actualmente vive con dos hijas y su esposo, sus hijas estudian y tiene el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en un taller de pintura; tiene su propia caseta donde vende y tiene mejores condiciones que en el corredor y los clientes son mejor atendidos. Actualmente con el préstamo ella compró sillas y mesas para brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
She began her small business selling snacks and natural beverages in the corridor of her home five years ago. Taking advantage of the opportunity to have her first loan with ADIM for US$100, she bought more snacks and offered fast food, breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. Today she lives with her two daughters and husband; her daughters study and she has the support of her husband who working in a paint shop. She has her own stand where she sells and she has better conditions that the corridor and her customers are better served. Today with the loan she will buy chairs and tables to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make food

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo ropa interior de damas y caballeros en un canasto hace cuatro años, aprovecha la oportunidad de tener un primer crédito con ADIM invirtiendo el financiamiento para comprar ropa para adultos y caballeros de mejor calidad incluyendo variedad de chinelas, actualmente cuenta con tres canastos y exposición de ropa.  

Atiende el negocio ella sola trabajando todos los días, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, tiene dos hijos pequeños de 4 y 6 años, los que se los cuidan en su casa. Ella sueña con mejorar el lugar de venta y ofrecer zapatos variados para la clientela que se los solicita.
texts.en:
She started her small business selling women’s and men’s underwear in a four years ago. She took advantage of having the first credit with ADIM, investing the financing to buy clothing for adults and gentlemen of the best quality including a variety of flip-flops. She currently has three carts and a clothing display. She runs the business by working there herself every day and with her husband’s help. She has two small children who are 4 and 6 years old who are taken care of in her house. She dreams of improving her sales location and offering varied shoes for her clientele that asks for them.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Esmelda

texts.es: Junto con su nieta inició su pequeño negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante en Tola, actualmente ella vende en una caseta ubicada en el mercado donde ofrece sus productos, también vende sus productos de forma ambulante. Con el financiamiento de ADIM ella ofrece gaseosas y una variedad de comidas como tacos, atol, etc. Ella piensa seguir creciendo con los créditos que ADIM le pueda dar y un día vender comidas: como almuerzos, desayunos, también contratar a una persona que cocine los alimentos y ella atender más la venta. Vive sola con una hija, pero ella tiene su negocio independiente, le apoya con algunos gastos de la casa y le da ayuda a la nieta con algunas cosas personales.
texts.en:
Along with her granddaughter, Esmelda began her small business selling in Tola on foot. Currently, she sells from a small stand located in the market where she offers her products. She also sells her products on foot. With the financing from ADIM, she offers sodas and a variety of food like tacos, atol (a Central American drink), etc. She is thinking of continuing to grow with the loans that ADIM can give her and, one day, sell food such as lunches, breakfasts, and also hire a person to cook the dishes so that she may attend more to selling. She lives alone with her daughter, but she owns her business independently. She helps her with some of the bills and gives her granddaughter help with personal things.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira Pandžić was born in 1965 and she lives in Visoko, in the central part of Bosnia Herzegovina. She is married and has twins who are 14 years old. Her husband works in a communal company. Besides that, he is really good at reselling  secondary raw materials. He does that after work time and on the weekends. Amira helps him by collecting and sorting the materials. Sometimes they get an offer to buy a bigger quantity of these materials but they are not able to buy it because they have no reserve money. So Amira decide to take a loan in WWI in the amount of 1500 KM. She will use this loan to buy secondary raw materials. This will provide Amira and her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy secondary raw materials

loans.name: Šerifa

texts.en: ŠErifa Pandžić is 38 years old and comes from Visoko, a litlle town near Sarajevo. She is married and has three children. Her husband has a regular job and ŠErifa does not. But, ŠErifa is busy collecting and selecting secondary raw materials every day. Her children are helping her in her daily work. ŠErifa`s husband does the same when he is not at his job. Once a week they bring the materials to a collection point. From time to time they find somebody who has more reserves of secondary raw materials and they buy them. They need some cash to be able to buy them whenever they have the chance. Erifa will take a loan from WWI which amounts to 1500 KM to buy materials for reselling. This is their way to make some progress in their lives.

loans.use: To buy secondary row materials

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa Kamarić was born in 1955. She lives in the village of Pribava near Gračanica. She is married and lives with her husband, daughter and two grandchildren. She helps her daughter with raising her children because she is divorced. Hanifa has worked as a tailor at home for a long time. She has her constant clients in neighbourhood and beyond. She has one old sewing machine and she needs another one. That is the reason that she is taking a loan from WWI in the amount of 500 KM. Hanifa wants to improve her business and provide a better life for her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machine

loans.name: Nafija

texts.en: Nafija Osmanbegović was born in 1961 and she comes from Gračanica. Nafija is divorced and lives with her mother, who is retired. She works as saleswoman in a local shop and she earns 500 KM. She works in a shop so she has enough time for working in her orchard. Her mother owns this orchard and charges Nafija no rent, since she is happy that somebody takes care of the orchard. Nafija produces plums and she sells them in the local market. She has a plan to extend her business and she will need someplace to store her products and a place where she will keep the things that she needs for her orchard. That is the reason that she want a loan from WWI which amounts to 1500 KM. Her wish is to keep her orchard in a good state and extend it little by little.

loans.use: To build a store place for products

loans.name: Mukiibi Lawrence, Zikusooka Group

texts.en:
Lawrence M. is a member of the Zikusooka women's group in Nkokonjeru and has a clinic that has been operational for 7 years. Before the clinic, Lawrence was a farmer with mostly matooke and sweet potatoes plantations plus cattle for milk and meat. But as a result of getting a surplus income, he started a clinic that he works in it with his daughter, a nursing assistant. He is married with 8 children and his wife is mostly managing their family farm. Two of his children finished school and are now managing their own families, while 6 are still in school. The loans he gets mostly help with school fees and are partly invested in his farm and clinic. Whenever Lawrence repays his loans, he saves and some time he will be able to use the savings to construct a big family house.

He is now in need of a loan to be able to buy some goats and pigs to keep at home to top up the income he gets from selling milk. He is so grateful for the work of Kiva. When I explained to him what Kiva does, he said it's unbelievable.

loans.use: Buy some goats and pigs to keep at home.

loans.name: Dembe Lending Group

texts.en:
Robinah N. is the leader of Dembe Women's Group, which has been in existence for 5 years. She is a married woman and works with her husband for the benefit of their family. Robinah has 2 businesses. She is a farmer growing mostly bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes as well as making local alcohol for sale to bars around her home and to those in town centers.

The local brews she makes are waragi and tonto. She prepares spear grass that is mixed with the ripe juice of bananas (mabidde). The juice that comes out is put into jerry cans and sorghum is mixed in. The cans are put in a previously dug hole and covered for a week or two and the end result is tonto. For waragi, the tonto is again put into metal cans and placed on a fire with a tube that connects to two more metal cans from which the boiled tonto moves and is cooled. In a week, Robinah can make and sell 8 jerry cans of tonto and 7 of waragi for wholesale as she also sells it to her daily customers that drink it at her home. Robinah needs a loan to be able to buy more bananas and pay labor for collecting the grass for her local brew business.

loans.use: Buy more bananas and pay labor for collecting the grass for her local brew business.

loans.name: Namisango, Alinyikira Group

texts.en: Gorreti N. and Zeed need a loan. Gorreti is 33 years old with 2 kids as she cares for 2 orphans who belonged to her late brother. She has had a stall in Makindye selling tomatoes, onions, green pepper, carrots, ginger and many other products for 5 years and it is from this business that she has been able to buy a plot and build a house. Now her plan is to build commercial houses, and she believes she can achieve it by buying more of these goods for sale.

loans.use: Restock her stall with more produce for sale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, es una mujer con deseos de superación, pues quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio en lo posible, puesto que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona. Mediante esta actividad educó y crió a sus 6 hijos, quienes ahora son profesionales e independientes. En  la actualidad, se quedaron solos ella y su esposo José Antonio, quien la apoya mucho en este, su negocio. Leonor a sus  58 años de edad demuestra ser una mujer proactiva que contagia entusiasmo a todo aquel que la conoce, sin embargo para llegar a cumplir con su objetivo, estima de un capital, dinero que invertirá en su negocio y de esta manera cumplir con su meta trazada. Apoyemos a esta madre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Leonor has worked selling food for a long time. She is a woman with the desire to advance in life as she wants to expand her business however possible because it is located in a good location. Through this activity she educated and raised her 6 children who are now professionals and independent. She is currently alone with her husband José Antonio, who supports her very much in her business. Leonor at 58 years old demonstrates herself to be a proactive woman whose enthusiasm is contagious. However, to achieve her objective she needs capital, money which will be invested in her business and in this way she will meet her goal. Let’s support this mother that demonstrates her will to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and improve her food sales business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 son independientes y de familia, quedando los dos últimos a su cargo, los mismos que son la razón para seguir adelante y prosperar en todo, ella desea poder lograr que sus hijos, más adelante, sean profesionales y  así sentirse una mamá orgullosa. En la actualidad, Luz se dedica la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, así como también vende comida y brinda pensión a los trabajadores de un aserradero frente a su casa, actividades que le permiten vivir tranquilamente, pero ella quiere que en el futuro su negocio sea más grande, su esposo Artemio que trabaja como chofer de máquinas pesadas, siempre la apoya en todo y juntos se anima para seguir adelante.Luz quiere implementar su negocio, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Luz is 44 years old and is the mother 5 children, 3 of whom are independent and have their own families. This leaves her with the 2 lasts ones in her care, which is her reason for seeking to get ahead and prosper in everything. She wants to be able to achieve that her children in the future are professionals and in this way she will feel like a proud mother. At the present time, Luz works selling groceries and household products as well as food and she provides lunch to the laborers of a sawmill in front of her house. These activities allow her to live tranquilly, but she wants her business to be bigger in the future. Her husband Artemio works as a driver of heavy machinery. He always supports her in everything and together they are motivated to advance in life. Luz wants to start her business, which is why she requires a loan that will allow her to meet her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for the improvement of her business: her small store and food sales.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
El Sr. Andrés tiene 53 años, esta casado con la Sra. Cristina, tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos cursando la universidad.

El Sr.Andres tiene una agencia de viajes en la ciudad de San Lorenzo hace 16 años, vende boletos de pasajes para distintos puntos del interior del país y también para Argentina y Brasil. La Sra. Cristina anteriormente trabaja en una institución financiera del cual tuvo que renunciar para apoyarle a su marido en el negocio en donde tienen buena demanda de viajeros.

Gracias al esfuerzo de toda la familia pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda y seguir pagando los gastos de la universidad de uno de ellos.

En el futuro tiene pensado abrir más locales en distintos puntos del país.
texts.en:
Andres is 53 years old and is married to Cristina. They have two older children one of whom is in college. Andres has had a travel agency in San Lorenzo for sixteen years. He sells tickets to various locations in the country as well as to Argentina and Brazil. Cristina used to work at a financial institution but she had to quit to help her husband at the travel agency as they have a high demand from travelers. Thanks to the efforts of the entire family they were able to finish building their home and continue paying for their child’s college tuition. In the future, they hope to open more locations in various parts of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishing travel agency.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia tiene 32 años y esta casada con el señor Reinerio Villasanti y tienen 4 hijos todos menores de edad.

Basilia anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de juegos de azar por la calle y hace 5 años que logro montar su despensa con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja constructor de obras.

Vive en casa propia que heredo de sus padres.

En el futuro desea comprar un vehiculo para transportar sus mercaderías y no seguir pagando fletes.
texts.en:
Ms. Basilia A. is 32 years of age, married to Mr. Reinerio Villasanti, and has 4 underage children.

Basilia used to sell games of chance on the street, but she managed to set up her own general store 5 years ago with the help of her husband, who works in construction.

She lives in her own home, which she inherited from her parents.

In the future, she would like to purchase a vehicle in order to transport her goods and not have to keep paying shipping costs.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods such as flour, cooking oil, rice, noodles, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna, de 35 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y otros productos desde ya hace mucho tiempo. Es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales  son sus ganas de seguir adelante, su esposo Rubén es trabajador independiente, y siempre está de acuerdo con lo que su esposa decide con respecto a la mejora de su negocio.Las aspiraciones que tiene Digna, para sus hijos, son brindarles por el momento sus estudios y lo necesario para que se sientan felices.Quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, por eso que desea ampliar su tienda y posteriormente quiere tener un minimarket, para ello, necesita de un capital para cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Digna, who is 35 years old, has been selling groceries and other products for a long time. She is the mother of 3 children, who inspire her to keep going. Her husband Rubén works independently and is always in agreement with what his wife decides to do to improve her business. The ambitions she has are for her children - to provide them with schooling and with whatever is necessary for their happiness. She wants to continue growing her business, which is why she wants to expand her store and later on, to have a mini-market. For this, she needs a loan to reach her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and make improvements to her store.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El Sr. Ceferino tiene 51 años y esta casado con la Sra. Eva, tienen 2 hijos, ambos están en edad estudiantil.

El Sr. Ceferino tiene una herrería hace 16 años en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se dedica al arreglo de llantas de los colectivos, hace portones sobre pedido y algunas obras más.

Esta profesión aprendió de su padre quien se dedico a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo, quien le ha enseñado todo lo que sabe. La Sra. Eva trabaja en el Poder Judicial hace bastante tiempo. Gracias al esfuerzo de ambos, pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda.

En el futuro tiene pensado abrir un local grande para poder mostrar sus mercaderías y mayor venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ceferino is 51 years old; he is married to Mrs. Eva and they have 2 school aged children. Mr. Ceferino has owned a blacksmith shop for the last 16 years in the city of San Lorenzo. He makes a living fixing the tires; he also makes gates by order and other odd jobs.

He learned this profession from his father, who worked in this trade for a long time and showed him everything he knows. Mrs. Eva has worked at the judiciary for a long time. Thanks to the efforts of both, they have been able to build their home.

In the future, they are thinking about opening a large shop where they can display their products and therefore increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will use this loan to purchase iron.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Sus aspiraciones desde muy joven, han estado en el arte textil, es por eso que Lina es una excelente costurera, cuenta con sus máquinas de coser, que le son de mucha utilidad para la realización de su trabajo diario, que es la confección de ropa, la cual vende a domicilio, la deja al contado  o al crédito, su labor es muy requerida por su buen acabado, incluso trabaja con varias instituciones educativas para la confección de uniformes para los niños del nivel inicial.Lina, a sus 40 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, a quienes les brinda todo lo necesario para sus estudios, hasta que decidan qué profesión desempeñarán, ella es madre soltera, sin embargo esto no trunca sus propósitos, ya que cuenta con el apoyo y amor de sus hijos.Su meta es alquilar un local y poner su taller de costura, para ello estima de una cantidad de dinero, la cual solicita en calidad de préstamo.
texts.en:
Lina’s aspirations from a young age have been in the textile arts which is why she is an excellent seamstress. She relies on her sewing machines which are highly useful in her daily work of making clothes. She sells this clothing door to door for cash or credit. Her work is highly sought after because it is well made. She also works with various educational institutions to make children’s uniforms. Lina, at forty years old, has three children. She provides them with everything necessary for their schooling. She is a single mother but this does not affect her goals because she counts with the support and love of her children. Her goal is to acquire a commercial space for her shop but this requires a sum of money which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a commercial space for her shop.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia (49) años vende productos de abarrote en su domicilio, constituyendo así su propia bodega, adicionalmente se dedica a la venta comida a la hora D. almuerzo. Su esposo Raúl es pescador y mientras está en casa la apoya mucho. Ambos tienen como responsabilidad a su último hijo, quien cursa el nivel secundario, hacen todo lo posible para que no le falte nada y siga adelante en sus estudios. Ahora Zonia, requiere de un capital para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, además de apoyar a su esposo con la implementación de instrumentos para la pesca, por lo que ella solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Zonia is 49 years old and sells grocery products in her home, constituting her own grocery store. Additionally, she works selling food at lunchtime. Her husband Raúl is a fisherman and when he is home he helps her a lot. Both are responsible for their last son, who is in secondary school. They do everything possible so that he is not without anything and so that he advances in his studies. Now Zonia requires capital to increase the merchandise in her store as well as to support her husband with the production of fishing instruments, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise of her small store as well as to acquire fishing supplies for her husband.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María G. tiene 45 años esta separada, tiene dos hijas y una nieta, ella trabaja en su casa con sus hijas. Ella cose a maquina y sus hijas bordan y pintan sus productos, para luego venderlos en distintos lugares a crédito.

Ella anteriormente tenia una despensa y cuando se separo de su esposo tuvo que cerrar la misma a raíz de la situación difícil del momento, pero sueña con volver a abrir algún día este negocio para así obtener un ingreso extra junto con sus hijas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria G. is 45 years old, is separated, and has two daughters and a granddaughter. She works in her house with her daughters. She sews by machine and her daughters embroider and paint their products to then sell them on credit in various places.

She previously had a general store and, when she separated from her husband, she had to close it because of the difficult situation at the time. However, she dreams of someday opening this business again and therefore obtaining extra income together with her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, linen, thread, and other things for making her products

loans.name: Ruseli

texts.es: Ruseli se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en su bodega, tiene 37 años y tres hijos, para ella no existe nada imposible, ya que es una mujer muy activa y sobre todo jovial con sus hijos y clientes, muy aparte D. su bodega brinda servicios D. cabinas D. Internet y venD. helados, por lo que su esposo Alfredo (maderero) la apoya en todas sus decisiones y brinda le su ayuda cuando está en casa, dándole la mano en su negocio. Ruseli es una mujer con ganas D. superación y deseos D. éxito, se esmera mucho por sus hijos, quienes, desea, sean hombres y mujeres D. bien en un futuro, aunque no pueda darles estudios universitarios, comenta. Quiere ver crecer su negocio, para ello requiere D. una cantidad D. dinero que la ayuD. a incrementar y ampliar su mercaD.ía, y así, poco a poco cumplir su propósito.
texts.en:
Ruseli works selling everyday products in her small store. She is 37 years old and has three children. For her nothing is impossible as she is a very active woman and above all cheerful with her children and clients. In addition to her small store she offers Internet cabin services and sells ice cream. Her husband Alfredo (woodworker) supports her in all of her decisions and provides her with help with he is at home, giving her a hand in her business. Ruseli is a woman with the will to get ahead. She does her best for her children who she wants to be successful men and women in the future, although she cannot pay for their university studies, she comments. She wants to see her business grow, and for this she requires a quantity of money that will help her to improve and expand her merchandise through which she will achieve her purpose little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise of her small store as well as to expand her space.

loans.name: Lila

texts.es: Lila, de 33 años es soltera, de profesión profesora de educación secundaria, es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que maneja y cuida su hermano. Además, también tiene una pequeña panadería, organiza y dirige a un grupo de personas que llevan a vender el pan en sus triciclos por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Lila vive con sus padres Víctor y Olga quienes la apoyan mucho y son el significado de Lo que desea, es dar a sus padres lo que necesitan para estar felices, ya que lo más importante para ella, es que estén a su lado. Ahora, y por lo que solicita este préstamo, es para la mejora de las condiciones de su motocarro, le urge comprar una serie de repuestos, además de invertir también en su panadería.
texts.en:
Lila, 33 years old, is single and is a secondary school teacher. She is the owner of a motor-taxi which her brother drives and maintains. In addition, she also has a small bakery and organizes and manages the group of people who take the bread to sell on their tricycles through many different areas in their zone. Lila lives with her parents Víctor and Olga who support her very much. What she wants is to give her parents what they need to be happy as the most important thing for her is that they are at her side. Now she is requesting this loan to improve the condition of her motor-taxi as she urgently needs to purchase a series of parts in addition to also investing in her bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts to repair her motor-taxi and invest in her bakery.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es: Enith, mujer decidida y de mucha energía física, en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida, y gracias a su buena atención y amabilidad cuenta con variada clientela que degustan de su buena sazón. Se siente satisfecha con este negocio, sin embargo, extraña su anterior rutina como instructora aeróbica, la misma que dejó por falta de máquinas y otros motivos.Ahora se trazó el propósito de implementar un pequeño gimnasio con máquinas nuevas y desde luego brindar la comodidad a sus clientes que requieren de este servicio para mantenerse en forma. Y para poder realizar lo que quiere necesariamente requiere de un préstamo.
texts.en:
Enith is determined woman with lots of physical energy. She currently works selling food, and thanks to her great service and friendliness she has a variety of customers who enjoy her flavors. She feels satisfied in this business; however, she misses her former routine as an aerobics instructor, which she had to quit because of a lack of equipment. Now she has drawn up a plan to install a small gym with new equipment, and from then on give her customers the comfort they need to stay in shape. To be able to achieve what she wants, she needs a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a small gym

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 49 años, es madre de 6 hijos, a los mismos que gracias  a su esfuerzo y trabajo sacó adelante, siendo ahora ya profesionales e independientes, hijos, que en su momento fueron su esperanza de seguir adelante. Ahora la señora Reyna solo tiene a su lado a su esposo Feliciano, quien la ayuda mucho, y es quien madruga para comprar en el puerto, el pescado que ella vende. Trabaja para sentirse bien y útil, y desde luego mejorar su economía.Reyna quiere comprar un puesto en el mercado, es por eso que necesita de un capital que le permita cumplir su objetivo.  Apoyemos a esta madre que con ahínco y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente  para prosperar.
texts.en:
Reyna is 49 years old and mother of six children, who have a good life thanks to her effort and work; her children are already professionals and independent. They were her hope for making a better life. Now Señora Reyna only has her husband Feliciano at her side, who helps her a lot by waking up in the very early morning to buy fish from the harbor that Reyna sells. She works to feel good and useful and lately to improve her economy. Reyna wants to buy a stand at the market, and it is for this reason that she needs capital to fulfill her objective. Let's support this mother, who with much determination and effort continues working arduously to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a stand at the market for selling fish.

loans.name: Sonia María

texts.es: Heredó de su mamá un pequeño negocio vende de manera ambulante en el mercado de Rivas donde ofrece gaseosas y una variedad de comidas como vigorón, tacos, etc. Con el crédito obtenido en ADIM pretende seguir creciendo y un día vender en un lugar fijo comidas rápidas variadas e incrementar mas la venta. Trabaja todos los días con horario de 6am. Hasta las 10 am. que es donde ya ha acabado de vender, en ese momento realiza las compras de la comida de su casa. Vive con su esposo que es maestro de escuela y sus dos hijas, a las que ella piensa darles estudios y que tengan una profesión.
texts.en:
Sonia inherited from her mother a little business doing sales in a traveling manner at the Rivas market, where she offers sodas and a variety of foods like vigorón (a Nicaraguan dish of pickled cabbage, tomatoes, onions, yuca, and fried pork skins), tacos, etc. With the loan obtained from ADIM, she aims to conitnue growing and one day sell her quick foods from a set location and increase her sales. She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m., which is when sales ends, and at this time she makes ingredients purchases from her home. She lives with her husband, who is a school teacher, and their two daughters, who she plans to give an education so they will have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy primary ingredients.

loans.name: Lenin

texts.es: Lenin es un hombre trabajador, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, es propietario de dos motocarros, uno de ellos lo maneja él, y el otro, su hermano, a quien le brinda trabajo de esa forma. Lenin es padre de 3 hijos, los cuales estudian y lo quieren mucho, su esposa Lucia quien se dedica a al venta de ropa, también lo apoya mucho y está de acuerdo con lo que se propone para el progreso familiar.Lo más importante es hacer estudiar a sus hijos, para que en un mañana sean profesionales.El motivo por el que solicita este préstamo es para comprar repuestos para mejorar sus motos, gracias a esta actividad estabilizó su economía y su nivel de vida, por ello quiere crecer en este rubro, y posteriormente comprarse otras motos.
texts.en:
Lenin is a hardworking man dedicated to transporting passengers for many years now. He is the owner of two motocarts: one of them is driven by Lenin and the other by his brother, to whom he offers a job in this way. Lenin is the father of three children, who study and love him very much. His wife, Lucia, who is dedicated to selling clothing, also supports him a lot and agrees with his plans for their family. The most important thing is to make his kids study, so that one day they will be professionals. He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to improve his motocarts. Thanks to this activity, his economy and lifestyle is stable, and he wants to grow in this business, and eventually buy other motocarts.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts for his motocarts.

loans.name: Bety

texts.es: Bety, de 50 años de edad, es madre de 8 hijos, siendo 6 de ellos independientes y quedando los dos últimos que estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante, vive con su esposo César que se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente, es albañil, y la apoya mucho. Bety se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo,  para poder contribuir con sus gastos familiares, debido a su carisma tiene muchos clientes, ellos tienen pedidos, por eso, se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, sin embargo no es el único trabajo que realiza, pues también trabaja prestando dinero, también requiere de un capital para lograr su meta trazada, que es tener una casa de empeños. Con tu apoyo la señora Bety logrará lo que desea.
texts.en:
Bety, who is 50 years old, is a mother to 8 children, of which 6 are independent and only the last two are still going to school; they are her reason to keep going. She lives with her husband, Cesar, who is an independent construction worker and supports her a lot. Bety has made a living selling groceries for a long time now in order to help pay for family expenses. Due to her charisma, she has many clients. They all have outstanding orders and that is why she needs to expand her business. However, this is not the only job she does; she also loans money which also requires capital. Her goal is to open a pawn shop, and with your help, Bety will achieve what she dreams of.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the stock in her store and open a pawn shop.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: Amanda (37), se dedica a la confección de ropa interior (Lencería) desde ya hace muchísimo tiempo, sus prendas las lleva a vender por diferentes lugares de su zona, y desde luego cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo Rolando, quien es trabajador dependiente en una empresa de su zona. Amanda es madre de 4 hijos, los mismos que están estudiando y desea apoyarlos hasta que puedan ser profesionales y sean unas personas buenas y felices.Ahora tiene un propósito, que es poner un taller de lencería, ya que cuenta con una buena gama de clientes, para ello le es necesario un capital, por lo que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Amanda (37) has been making undergarments (lingerie) for a very long time. She sells her garments throughout her zone, counting on the unconditional support of her husband, Rolando, who works for a company in the region. Amanda has 4 children, who are all studying. She wishes to support them until they receive their degrees and become good and happy people. She now has the goal of setting up a lingerie sewing workshop since she has a well-established client-base. For this, she needs to have capital, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Implement lingerie sewing workshop

loans.name: Martha Alejandra

texts.es: La señora Martha  Alejandra S. C. tiene 2 hijos los cuales  están  en escuelas privadas. Uno de ellos cursa  preescolar pero le cobran la mitad de la colegiatura ya que ella trabaja ahí, el  hijo mayor esta en preparatoria  pero acostumbra pagar por adelantado por que en esta escuela da un descuento de cierto porcentaje al pagar con anticipación. Es su segundo crédito y estamos convencidos que es un persona puntual para efectuar otro préstamo. Pero Alejandra no cuenta con tal cantidad ella vino a nuestras instalaciones solicitando 275 dólares. Ella trabaja en una escuela de cocinera este lugar también maneja guardería ,su esposo se dedica a hacer platillos de comida.
texts.en:
Martha Alejandra has two children in private school. One is in preschool, but half the cost is covered because she works there. Her oldest son is in preparatory school, and she tries to pay the tuition in advance because the school gives a discount for those payments. But she can not make such a payment currently, so she came to our institution requesting a loan of $275. She works at a cooking school that also runs a daycare center. Her husband makes a living making and selling meals. This is her second loan, and we are convinced that she is a person who can timely repay another line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: En compañía de su hija atiende su pequeño negocio de soda ofreciendo variedad de comidas rápidas y los fines de semana almuerzos, bocadillos, fritanga siendo reconocida por la calidad de sus comidas. Con el crédito obtenido en ADOM compró una refrigeradora para preservar los alimentos y vender gaseosas y refrescos, pretende seguir creciendo y un día mejorar el local que es en su casa de habitación. Trabaja todos los días y hace además hace las labores de su casa. Vive con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura y que los fines de semana le ayuda a atender en la soda.
texts.en:
In the company of her daughter she attends to her small "soda bar" or pub business offering a variety of fast foods, and during the weekend, lunches – serving baguette sandwiches and “fritanga” (a variety of barbequed meats, vegetables, and fruit), and being well-known for the quality of her foods. With the loan obtained from ADIM she purchased a refrigerator to keep foods and to sell sodas and refreshments. She tries to keep growing and to one day improve her premises that are in her home. She works every day and on top of that, works taking care of her home. She lives with her husband who works in agriculture and during the weekends helps her in the pub.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Basic Ingredients

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es: Tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa donde ofrece diferentes productos a los clientes de la comunidad y personas que pasan a las comunidades cercanas. Con el crédito obtenido en ADIM  logró engrandecer un poco su negocio. Trabaja todos los días y hace además las labores de su casa. Piensa seguir obteniendo financiamiento para ofrecer más productos a su clientela, como ropa y adornos. Siente que con su negocio ella es más respetada dentro de su comunidad y en su familia, su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos, tienen una niña que le ayuda a despachar en la pulpería que también estudia, ella quiere que su hija tenga una profesión en el futuro.
texts.en:
She has a small general store in her house where she sells various products to clients in the community and to those passing through to nearby towns. With the loan obtained in ADIM she was able to enlarge her business a little. She works every day and on top of that, works taking care of her home. She thinks she will continue obtaining financing in order to offer more products to her clients such as clothing and ornaments.
