Amancio, buscando una salida al desempleo, decidió dedicarse a la venta ambulante de las artesanías que su esposa hace, y ya lleva más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad que ambos realizan con mucho éxito, recorriendo varias ciudades.

Con el ingreso que le genera dicha actividad lograron construir su casa propia, comprar comodidades y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos de colores varios para que su esposa pueda tejer mayor variedad de mantas, pues sus clientes demandan en mayor cantidad en esta época del año.
texts.en:
Mr. Amancio, 41 years old, has been married for more than 20 years to Mrs. Catalina Martínez, 35 years old, and they have school-going children. They live in their own house in the Simbrón company in the town of Roque González.

Don Amancio is the son of a very well-known farmer in the area and at the age of 26 he married doña Catalina who is from a modest family and who made hand-woven cotton blankets for a living. Catalina's entire family were weavers so she was trained in the artcrafts weaving trade.

Amancio,being unemployed, decided to become a street vendor selling his wife's handcrafts and he has been doing this for the past 15 years and they are both very successful selling in different towns.

With the earnings they have been able to build their own house, buy comforts, and thus improve their quality of life. The loan requested will be spend on purchasing different colored yarn for his wife to weave more varied blankets as demand grows this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cotton yarn in a variety of colors.

loans.name: Las Fantasticas Group

texts.es:
Juliana inicio el negocio para prosperar, cuando le dieron su casa nueva y no tenía suficientes ingresos para sostenerse. Comenzó surtiendo mercancía poco a poco hasta que fue haciendo crecer su negocio. Ahora requiere un préstamo para comprar mercancía y comprar un exhibidor.

Aglaeth porque no completaba con el sueldo de su esposo la falta de ingreso y el nacimiento de uno de sus hijos empezó vendiendo productos para el hogar por catalogo entre sus vecinas y ellas misma la fueron recomendando con mas gente, ahora necesita un préstamo para comprar mercancía.

Olinda inicio el negocio por los escases de trabajo ya que no podia dejar a sus hijos pequeños para irse a trabajar, fue entonces que empezó vendiendo quesos con sus vecinas hasta que hizo una pequeña ruta y fue surtiendo en las tiendas de las colonias vecinas. Ahora requiere un préstamo para comprar un enfriador donde poner su mercancía.

El Grupo Fantásticas requiere un préstamo por US $700 que pagaran en 3 meses. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrán adelante.
texts.en:
Juliana started her business in order to get ahead when she received her new house and did not have sufficient income to support herself. She started carrying merchandise gradually until her business grew. She needs a loan to purchase merchandise and to purchase a display case.

Aglaeth started selling catalog home products because her husband's income was not sufficient after the birth of one of their children. She sells to her neighbors who themselves started recommending more people to her. She needs a loan to purchase merchandise.

Olinda started her business because work was scarce and she could not leave her young children alone while she was at work. This is when she started selling cheeses to her neighbors. She eventually established a small route and started supplying the stores in the neighboring neighborhoods. She needs a loan to purchase a refrigerator for her merchandise.

"Grupo Fantasticas" is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 which it will repay in 3 months. With your help they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Julia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 35 años. Ella tiene una tienda en la que vende ropa. Ella empezó este negocio hace ocho años. Anteriormente vendía ropa en un puesto ambulante, sin embargo, los ingresos que obtenía eran insuficientes, por lo que decidió poner una tienda en una galería de ropa.
El último crédito que Rosa recibió lo invirtió en mercadería para su negocio. 
Ella cuenta que necesita un crédito adicional que le permita comprar una máquina de confección de prendas de vestir, así podría expandir su negocio y empezar a vender la ropa que ella misma diseña.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old. She has a store where she sells clothing. A business which she started eight years ago. Previously she sold clothing at different stalls. Even so, the income she obtained was not sufficient which is why she decided to open a store. Rosa used the last loan that she received to purchase merchandise for her business. She needs an additional loan to purchase a sewing machine so that she can expand her business and start selling clothes that she designs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora por su negocio, vende productos de dulcería (rosquillas, suspiros, pan casero, entre otros), ella los prepara en su domicilio, su esposo Javier la apoya mucho y es él quien se encarga de hornear estos dulces. A sus 45 años, es madre de 8 hijos, de los cuales 3 son independientes, quedando a su cargo 5 de ellos, que estudian y son sus ganas de seguir adelante, diariamente ruega al Todo Poderoso que siempre los proteja y los guíe por el buen camino.Doña Julia quiere seguir superándose, y mandar a construir habitaciones en su casa para alquiler, es por eso que requiere del préstamo que solicita para cumplir con su propósito.
texts.en:
Juliana is an enterprising woman and works hard in her business of selling candies and baked goods. She prepares these in her home with the help of her husband who is in charge of baking. At her 45 years of age, she is the mother of eight children three of whom are independent and five of whom are in her charge and in school hoping to get ahead. She prays daily that they be protected and be guided down the right path. Julia wants to keep getting ahead and wants to build rooms in her home to rent out which is why she needs the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build rooms in her home to rent out.

loans.name: Gesarela

texts.es: Gesarela a sus 54 años es madre 5 hijos que ya son profesionales e independientes. Se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante, ahora vive solo con su esposo Octavio quien es albañil.Ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas heladas (gaseosas, néctar y cerveza), es una mujer prometedora y luchadora cuando dice algo lo cumple y eso lo aplica en la mejora D. su calidad D. vida. Quiere implementar su negocio con otros productos, así como también ampliar y mejorar los ambientes donD. venD. sus productos, sin embargo, para lograr este propósito requiere D. esta cantidad D. dinero que solicita.
texts.en:
Gesarela is 54 years old and the mother of five children, who are all working professionals and living on their own. She now lives alone with her husband, Octavio, who is a contractor. She sells cold drinks (sodas, juices and beer), and works very hard to get ahead. She is a very promising woman and a fighter; she always keeps her word, especially when it comes to improving her own quality of life.

Gesarela would like to stock her store with different products and would also like to expand and improve the space in which she sells her drinks. She needs this Kiva loan to accomplish these goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a wider variety of products to sell, improve and expand store

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 26 años y es madre de 2 hijos quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando por salir adelante, también tiene a lado a su esposo Walter quien es rematista de plátanos y siempre le da la mano en lo que puede.Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este negocio es el que apoya en el sustento económico de su familia, y para brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario para sus estudios,  esperando que en un mañana lleguen a ser personas de bien.Delia desea ampliar su negocio, comprar más productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevará a cumplir con su objetivo. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Delia logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Delia is 26 years old and mother of 2 children who are her reason for living and continue fighting to be successful. She also has her husband, Walter, at her side, and he is a banana harvester and always gives a hand when he can. She sells groceries and basic needs products, and this business is what supports this family economically and provides the children what’s needed for their education, hoping that one day they will be successful. Delia wishes to expand her business, buy more food products, and above all improve the structure of her home, so she needs capital to complete these goals. Thanks to your help Delia will be able to achieve her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her business and improve the structure of her home where her store is located

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela es propietaria de dos motocarros, adicionalmente  se dedica  a la venta de comida por las noches, tiene dos hijos menores. Su esposo Sergio es el chofer de uno de los motocarros y es quien se dedica al cuidado de las motos. El dinero que solicita será invertido en el mantenimiento y arreglo de sus herramientas de trabajo, y mejorar su negocio de venta de comida,  para posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco para vender su comida cómodamente. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación  sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Mayela owns two motorcycles and also dedicates herself to selling food in the evenings. She has two young sons. Her husband Sergio drives one of the motorcycles and also takes care of their maintenance. The money she is requesting will be used to maintain the motorcycles and repair Sergio's tools and to improve Mayela's business of selling food so that she can build a kiosk to sell her food comfortably. Support this mother who with effort and dedication keeps working arduously to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of two motorcycles and investment in food selling business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo inició el negocio para tener un ingreso extra para poder solventar sus necesidades y la de sus hijos, ya que su sueldo en ocasiones era insuficiente y quería darles estudio. Comenzó en Marzo de 2005, con la elaboración y venta de comida cuando su esposa le sugirió participar en una “Tanda” de dinero para invertirlo en unas sillas y mesas en el patio de su casa el cual acondicionamos. Desde entonces les ha ido muy bien ya que les venden comida a compañeros de trabajo que también son choferes y en la actualidad tiene muchos clientes también gracias a sus hijos les ayudan mucho en la atención a los mismos. Gracias al anterior crédito que les proporcionó KIVA, pudieron capitalizarse y atender también algunas necesidades de mobiliario que tenían, así como volver a resurtir materia prima para seguir elaborando sus comidas.

El necesita un préstamo por US $375 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar materia prima que les permita seguir con su negocio de elaboración de comida. Con tu apoyo Eduardo seguirá con su negocio
texts.en:
Eduardo began his business in order to have extra income to meet his and his children’s needs, as his wages on occasion were insufficient and he wanted to give them an education. He began in March 2005 making and selling food when his wife suggested participating in a money “Tanda” to invest it in some chairs and tables on the patio of their home. (A “tanda” is when a group agrees that each member will contribute a quantity of money weekly, biweekly or monthly, and then that sum is distributed to a group member. Each group member will, in turn, receive the sum of money collected). Since then the business has gone very well for them as they sell food to their colleagues who work who are also drivers and today they have many customers thanks to their children who help them a lot by waiting on tables. Thanks to a previous loan through KIVA, they could invest and attend to some furniture needs that they had as well as restock ingredients to make their meals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia vende refrescos en un puesto del mercado Bellavista, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, y gracias a este negocio compró su motocarro, el mismo que es manejado y cuidado por su esposo Hugo, quien es técnico en mecánica de motores pesados. Ambos tienen como responsabilidad a sus dos hijos, los cuales estudian y esperan que algún día sean profesionales. Para lo que Amalia requiere el préstamo es para mandar a construir un kiosco, y así mejorar la atención y tener una mayor comodidad de venta.
texts.en:
Amalia sells soft drinks at a stall on the Bellavista market. She has been doing this for a long time and thanks to this business she has been able to buy a motorcar which is driven and taken care of by her husband, Hugo, who is a mechanic of heavy engines. They are both responsible for their two children who are students and hope to become professionals in the future. The loan requested will be spend on building a kiosk and thus improve service and obtain more comfort for the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk to improve sales.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia de 24 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, quienes son la razón de seguir adelante, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de golosinas y frutas, su esposo Abdiel la apoya en todas sus aspiraciones, él es trabajador dependiente. Silvia no solo se dedica a la venta de estos productos, sino también en sus ratos libres cose y confecciona ropa para niños y adultos, todo esto lo hace por sus hijos a quienes ama mucho. Para que en un mañana sean los profesionales que espera ver.Silvia  quiere incrementar su venta de golosinas y frutas y construir posteriormente un kiosco para venderlos, ella tiene muchas ideas de negocio, y para eso necesariamente estima de un capital que levantará sus ganas de seguir adelante y ver crecer su venta.
texts.en:
Silvia is 24 years old and has three children who are her reason for getting ahead. She has dedicated herself to selling candies and fruit for a long time. Her husbnad Abdiel supports her in all her aspirations and also works as a salesclerk. Silvia does not just dedicate herself to selling these products. In her free time, she also makes clothing for children and adults. She does all of this for her children whom she loves very much so that in the future they will be the professionals she hopes to see them become. Silvia wants to increase her sale of candies and fruits and build a kiosk where she can sell these products. She has a lot of ideas for her business which is why she needs money to elevate her desire to get ahead and to see her sales increase.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of candies and fruits that she sells and build a kiosk for their sale.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca de 23 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, quienes son su motivo de seguir luchando por salir adelante, junto a su esposo Juan, trabajan duro por sus hijos, esperando que algún día sean profesionales.Blanca  se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, este negocio es el que vela por el sustento económico  de ella y para los estudios de sus hijos.El propósito de Blanca es ampliar, comprar productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevará a cumplir con su objetivo.
texts.en:
Blanca is 23 years old; she has two children who are the reason she keeps fighting to get ahead. Together with her husband, Juan, they work hard for their children. They hope one day they will be professionals. Blanca makes a living selling groceries and everyday use items. This business is what pays for her expenses and that of her children's education. Blanca's objective is to expand and buy food items, and more importantly improve their home. This is why she needs money- to achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the stock in her store and improve the structure of her home where her business is based out of.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther tiene 36 años. Ella comparte un negocio familiar con su madre y hermanas. Ellas tienen un taller de bordado computarizado. El negocio empezó hace aproximadamente 2 años, antes Esther se dedicaba al bordado manual. 
Gracias a los créditos que Esther recibió anteriormente y en conjunto con su familia, logró comprar una máquina de bordado industrial.
Ella ahora necesita algo de capital, ya que uno de sus proyectos es comprar otra máquina de bordados que le permita duplicar su producción.
texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old. She shares a family business with her mother and sisters. They own a computerized embroidery shop. The business started approximately two years ago. Previously, Esther was dedicated to manual embroidery. Thanks to the loans that Esther received before, and together with her family, they were able to buy an industrial embroidery machine.

Now she needs some capital since one of their projects is to purchase another embroidery machine which will allow them to double production.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial embroidery machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es:
Ruperta tiene 58 años. DesD. hace varios años ella se dedica a la venta ambulante D. comida. Todas las noches ella sale con su carrito sanguchero, y regresa a casa muy tarD. después D. tanto trabajo.
Sin embargo, ella pensaba invertir en otro negocio, y así lo hizo con el último crédito que recibió. Ella, con la ayuda D. su esposo compró lubricantes para autos y empezó a distribuirlos en talleres mecánicos. Aunque ella dice que ahora se dedica a sus dos negocios, cuenta que le  urge un crédito para dar impulso a su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Ruperta is 58 years old. Some years ago she decided to sell food from a cart. Every night she leaves with her cart and returns home very late after her hard work. Regardless, Ruperta is hoping to invest in another business, and she did so with her last loan. With the help of her husband, she bought automobile oil and distributed it to auto shops. Even though she now dedicates her time to two businesses, she'd like to use this new loan to move her new business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her new automobile oil business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Simuzar

texts.en: Simuzar was born in 1966 and currently lives in Baku. She has three children, and her family's main source of income is a private transport business. Simuzar and her relatives (one of whom is pictured in the photograph) now need a loan of US$1,200 to buy spare car parts to improve and expand their business.

loans.use: Purchase of spare car parts

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur (his relative is pictured) is single man. He was born in 1981. Zaur and his relative have been in the business of building houses for 6 years. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy the necessary materials for building the houses.

loans.use: To buy the necessary materials for building the houses

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
T. Sherali has always been a hard-working man, who has made certain, from his young age, that his family never goes without daily bread. He is married with four children. He has a place in the central market of Djabbar Rasulov district where he sells different kinds sausages. With the starting capital of $400, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise 6 years ago in order to support his family. To this date, he is the main breadwinner in his large family. 

Today he needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the range of his goods. He is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni ($1050) for the term of 6 months. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Boginiso

texts.en:
Boginiso T. is 53 years old. She’s married with 2 children. Surrounded by beautiful and tame cows on pasture land, Boginiso is carrying out her daily work herding the grazing cattle. She has been dedicated to this occupation for the last eight years.

Boginiso works as cleaning staff at the same center as her dear husband. Both work very hard to support and offer an adequate education to their dearest children as they wish to give each of them the opportunity of enrolling in higher studies.

Boginiso wishes to buy calves for breeding and production of her own cattle and therefore she is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni (750 USD) which will be repaid over a period of 12 months. Let us help this industrious mother make her dreams come true, seeing her beloved children as professionals and with a bright future.

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand her business

loans.name: Afag

texts.en: Afag is 40 years old and has 3 children. She lives in Baku. For the past 10 years she has been running her own tailoring business. Currently, Afag needs a loan of US$1,200 to buy materials for sewing jackets and to be able to provide her clients with better services.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for sewing jackets

loans.name: Zaka

texts.en: Zaka is married and has 2 children. He is 48 years old and lives in Baku. For the past 17 years Zaka has been earning money as a shoe-maker. He now needs a loan of US$875 to buy the necessary materials for improving his shoe-making business.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for improving a shoe-making business

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.en:
T. Dilmurod is 23 years old. He is married and has a young child. For the past 10 years, Dilmurod has been producing sieves in his house. He learned this type of business from his father. Dilmurod became a real expert in his business and has a lot of clients. His wife helps him sell the sieves in the market. Because Dilmurod has many clients and demand for his goods, the business is very successful. The business provides a stable and significant income that allows Dilmurod to improve the living conditions of his family.

Now Hakimjon has orders for producing the sieves. So he is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) to purchase the raw materials for producing the sieves. With your help, this will be possible. Dilmurod is counting on your help and he expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing materials for production of sieves

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Vusal was born in 1979. He is married and has one child. He has been in this business for 10 years. He lives in Baku city. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the necessary things for improving his barber shop business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Nermina

texts.en:
Nermina Smajlović, who was born in 1960 and lives in Potočarima near Srebrenica, unfortunately lost her husband in war and is raising her three children alone. She has support income in the amount of 750 KM. Although not employed, Nermina keeps herself busy with farming, producing a variety of vegetables in her own field, mainly for her own use, but also occasionally earning a very small amount from vegetable sales.

Now that her children are older and can assist her, Nermina wants to try to earn more from her farming and is therefore requesting a loan to buy seeds for the autumn sewing. She is hoping to provide a better life for her family, beginning with this loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds for autumn sewing.

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma Begović, born in 1974, comes from Potočari near Srebrenica where she is married and has four children. Her husband is employed, but his salary is not sufficient to pay all of their expenses. One of their children is a student receiving study support in the amount of 150 KM (about $100), but study in Bosnia costs much more.

Selma raises cows, a good income source for the family, and she is requesting a loan in the amount of $725 to buy winter reserve food for her cattle.

loans.use: To buy food for her cattle.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Alma Mehmedović comes from Banovići, where she is married and the mother of a four-year-old child. Her husband is self-employed in transport while Alma is a housewife who keeps busy in her garden. As well, she raises sheep, earning income through the sale of sheep cheese. 

Alma wants to improve her business by buying a calf that, when grown, will provide her with milk both for family consumption and sale.  For this reason she is requesting a loan of $725.  This loan will contribute to a better life for Alma and her family.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Svjetlana

texts.en:
Svjetlana Božanović, born in 1989, comes from Doboj where she works in a coffee shop, earning over $350 monthly. She enjoys the work because it places her in constant contact with people who are potential clients for her home-based computer business, which revolves around designing and printing diplomas, marketing materials, price lists, etc.  

Because she needs a new printer and some other equipment to improve her business, Svjetlana is requesting a loan in the amount of $450.  This loan will allow her to expand her business and acquire more clients.

loans.use: To buy computer-related equipment.

loans.name: Hanča

texts.en:
Mehmedović, born in 1954, lives with her husband, a painter, in the village of Omazići near Banovići. Hanča, as almost every woman in a village, does much in her garden, field and home. She produces vegetables for her own use and has a cow whose milk she both sells and uses for home consumption. As well, she has a few chickens and now wishes to begin raising poultry.

Hanča’s husband helps her in his free time with all things and the request for a loan of $725 was a joint decision. Hanča will use this amount to buy poultry and poultry feed, with the ultimate goal of raising the family income through the establishment and expansion of a poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy poultry and poultry food.

loans.name: Mrs. Hor Srey Group

texts.en:
This group loan is located in Kampong Prasat Village in Kampon Chhnang Province. The group consists of four members and Mrs. Hor S. is the group leader. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery products for her inventory.

Her husband, Mr. Pin Mi, is a body guard in the market and he makes $42 per month which is a small income to support the whole family. Mrs. Hor S. is 44 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are too young to work or study because they are at the age of five and three.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Ly Pouv Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly P. is president of a village bank of ten people who all live in Thmo Sor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Ly P. is currently a cow middleman who buys cows and then re-sells later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to buy more cows to re-sell. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Man Yan, assists her in the business. Mrs. Ly P. is 36 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more cows for breeding and then re-selling at a better price.

loans.name: Mrs. Pen Yern Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of ten people who all live in Tropang Thmor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  Mrs. Pen Y. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  She is a farmer who cultivates O. a field of two hectares.  In her business, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough animals to plow the field.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to plow with the old one in order to grow rice.  Her husband, Mr. Phum ThO., helps her O. the plantatiO..  Mrs. Pen Y. is 52 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans.  Seven members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans.  These seven members are not required to pay any principal O. the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term.  Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments O. time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% O. Kiva.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to plow with the old one in order to grow rice.

loans.name: Mrs. Hout Srey Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people, who live in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, formed a village bank and they plan to use the obtained loan for different purposes. Mrs. Hout S. is village bank president and owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Kong Kan, is a bean middleman who buys bean to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. Mrs. Hout S. is 40 years old and the mother of five children, who are all attending the local school. (Mrs. Hang S. did not come to accept the loan, but her husband did and is present in the picture instead). 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for inventory

loans.name: Raufjon

texts.en:
Raufjon M. is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. Raufjon is a selfless father, and as a good head of household, he has in mind what he should do to support his family.

He decided to dedicate himself to raising livestock three years ago. He added everything he learned to the education his parents had instilled in him since he was a child. He plans to keep raising livestock and to acquire even more. This is why he is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) that will allow him to purchase more fodder for the normal development and competitiveness of his cattle. He promises to repay the loan in 12 months. He thanks all of you who kindly respond to his request.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Mrs. Chek Say Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank is located in Prea Reach Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and consists of eighteen members, who plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chek S. is the village bank president, and she is currently a cow breeder who is raising eight cows to sell. Her husband, Mr. Each Sok, owns a small plot of land for cultivating rice. Although Mrs. Chek S. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Chek S. decided to ask for a loan to start a new pig breeding business. Mrs. Chek S. is 40 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school.

(Mr. Tras R. did not come to accept the loan, but his wife did and is present in the picture instead).

This village bank loan is an end-of-term loan and all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the veR. end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To start a new pig breeding business.

loans.name: Haitboi

texts.en:
Y. Haitboi is 36 years old. He is married with 4 children. Haitboi has grown potatoes for more than 5 years. He has land of 1.8 hectares where he grows potatoes and other vegetables. In fact, he draws strength and vitality by  making his products the best in the city. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and a time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. 

Haitboi has a big family of 4 children, and they all go to school. Today he is requesting a loan of $1100 which he has committed to repay within 12 months. He wants to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables. The well-being of this family is on your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Haitboi’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo O. is 42 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells ice cream in her house, wholesale and retail. She has been in this business for the past five years. She prepares the ice creams and customers come to buy in bulk from her. She also sells retail to her consumers. 

Titilayo needs the loan amount of $850 to purchase a generator, as there is no constant electricity supply. This, she said, will enable her keep the ice cream frozen at all times as customers like the ice cream chilled. She says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy a generator for her ice cream business

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is 33 years old and married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 10 years old. Lola sells fruits like oranges, watermelon, pineapples, etc wholesale. She buys directly from those who bring the fruits from the neighboring villages. Lola needs the loan amount of $850 to buy more fruits in wholesale to enable her meet the demands of her numerous customers. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi O. sells provisions and has been in this business for the past eight years. She sells at retail to her customers. Oluwakemi is 35 years old and married to Mr. O.. They have four children. Oluwakemi needs the loan amount of $850 to purchase more provisions in bulk. This, she said, would enable her to meet the demands of her numerous customers and, thereby, increase her profit, which will enable her to take better care of her family. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provision for sale

loans.name: Ejime

texts.en: Ejime O. is 45 years old and is married with 2 children. Ejime is the leader of a lending group under LAPO MICROFINANCE. Ejime sells bunches of plantains. She has been in this business for the past nine years. She buys the bunches of plantains from surrounding villages and sells at the Ajegunle main market. Ejime needs the loan amount of $1200 to buy more bunches of plantains for sale. She says this will enable her to meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of Plantain for sale
